Our room had a little bit of a musty smell, but not too bad for an older motel. Bathroom was clean and extra linens were provided. Breakfast area was small, but the staff provided trays so that food could be carried to the room. Variety was typical for a continental breakfast; waffles, bagels, cereal, muffins, etc. They had a variety of toppings for waffles which my children appreciated.  The best thing going for this motel,

Summary Heading: Good room for a great price!
Summary: On our prior trips to Disneyland we stayed on the other side of the park at an independent hotel (named after the red & white Christmas candy) but this time we needed to be more budget conscious. We found this hotel,  and read reviews so knew what we were getting for the price. Of course we weren't expecting the Grand Californian, but we were pleasantly surprised with this great find.   There was a little confusion with booking  (when we called to confirm our reservations about a month before the trip they couldn't find it,  then they double booked rooms... eventually  it was straightened out), but that was the only issue with our entire stay. We had no issues with parking or noise.  Even on our day off from the park when we slept in the construction noise wasn't a bother.   The

Short walking distance to tram to take you to Disneyland. 4 star but decor very dated, rooms a little dark, but beds were very comfortable and the room was clean.  Manager really helpful.  Would stay again.

This Best Western is a great place to stay if you are going to Disneyland. It's within walking distance of the tram service that takes you Disneyland and there's no fee for parking your car there. The parking lot and the breakfast area are both on the small side but it's workable.

On a budget or just need a bed while visiting Disneyland this hotel is GREAT!!!!! Rooms are clean, staff is very friendly and most of all close to the park. Hotel Guest don't have to pay for parking. This alone makes this hotel great as most hotels in the area charge for parking. Located close to Disneyland parking garage makes accessing the shuttle very easy and if you want you may walk to the front gate as well.

Summary Heading: Good value and close to Disneyland
Summary: Really good place to stay as it's walking distance from Disneyland and other restaurants in the area. Really good customer service when we checked in and out. Beds are really comfortable and shower was excellent. Breakfast is ok and is in a tiny area but that's the only thing I could fault. Would stay here again.

It is just what I was expecting. The Hotel is a small, older facility that has a 4 Star location.      1st the hotel is located at the entrance for Disneyland employee parking. You walk into the employee parking entrance, follow the signs for the trams that take you into the park. It's a 3-4 minute easy walk with one flight of stairs. NO ELEVATORS or ESCALATORS for this side of the parking structure! You will need to climb a flight of stairs. This makes the Hotel a great value.       2nd The breakfast is very adequate. Though the area it is served in is small in the extreme. Have patience, wait your turn to dish up and take it back to your room.       3rd The Pool )-: Small and Basic is being generous. But we didn't come here to swim or layout and it's a good thing I didn't. It

We stayed here with my family of 4 for our disneyland trip. I think the location could not be better a short walk to the park and downtown Disney. the room was clean and spacious. Loved that it had a fridge and microwave. The beds were comfortable. only thing I did not love but I know they have no control over was they have some construction going on near by if you don't sleep with fan or ac you can hear it in the morning . Other than that it was great. Did not get the chance to take advantage of breakfast or pool . Next time! we will be back .

Good Disneyland value; included free Wi-Fi (albeit a little on the slow side), breakfast with waffles and hot items (eggs and sausages or bacon--except Fridays, when meat was replaced with fried potatoes).  Rooms were a little light on electrical outlets for computers, but manageable. Location is a short walk away from the tram stop. Overall, stay was very good.

Found roaches on my bed the night before going to Disneyland. I couldn't sleep all night worried about it making my day at Disneyland horrible from lack of sleep. When I told the front desk, in the morning, they were not surprised. Also, the parking is very limited. They have to double park your car so you have to leave the keys so they can move your car. Never staying here again...ever!!!!
Manager Response: Hi Ms. Bernadette,  I want to apologize for taking a long time on replying to your review.  At the Best Western Courtesy inn, we try to make a memorable stay for each and every guest.  It sounds like we fail on delivering an outstanding service during your stay.  I am very sorry but I did not see any notes indicating this type of scenario.  I can assure you that there is no "insect"  problem here at the property. To avoid this type of scenarios we have a contract with ISOTECH that inspects rooms on a monthly basis.  We have certain procedures and have to be follow.  I want to apologize about the parking incident, we do have limited parking (1 per room) and that's why we have a tracking system to ensure everyone gets a parking.  To further help you, I will need more information regarding your recent stay.  If you can call me direct @ 714-772-2470 ext. 0 Once again, thank you for staying with us and hope you can give us a second chance to provide with superior costumer service.   Front Desk Manager

Summary: Hotel is located in a great spot. If your staying at the hotel you can leave your car at the hotel & walk to the nearby tram. This saves you a ton of money paying for parking at the park.   The room is cozy, nothing fancy. The breakfast in the morning is pretty good. You have a choice of cereal, waffles, eggs, sausage, pastries, yogurt, etc... The front desk staff are very friendly & professional. I must say I was pleased.

Very bad customer service. Did not get problem fixed an important one or offered any change of room or discount.  Would like suggest this hotel to anyone.  Was on a busy street.  Could hear traffic and construction going on.  Service to fix shower/bath was not handled at all.

Very friendly staff. Very close to everything. The tram to disneyland is very convenient. The hotel just received new furniture. Ask about special rates and benefit program. The hotel is on a busy main road. The hotel is very easy to find has parking

We love this hotel! They have a  wonderful staff, clean rooms with very comfortable beds and a great breakfast offering something for everyone. Quick and easy. close to Disneyland and close to freeways.

Summary Heading: Affordable price and close to Disneyland
Summary: Bed 3/5Mattress firm/soft-very soft Room 4/5 room is clean.  Moderate number of outlets and lights.  Room has a flat screen TV. There is no desk area. Room has  refrigerator, microwave and a coffee maker.Shower warmed up moderate but has good pressure.  wi fi included in the resort fee. Wall unit air conditioner.  Price $$ Proximity 4/5 walking distance to Disneyland. Limited food options within walking distance. They do offer complimentary breakfast. Downtown Disney is a 20 minute walk. No fee for parking but parking seems to limited.   ***Currently there is construction right behind the hotel and it got a bit loud in the morning. Also my toilet backed up for no reason but it was fixed after borrowing a plunger.

Our room was very accommodating.  We loved being so close to Disneyland.  We walked to the park everyday and were able to watch the fireworks from our hotel at night!  The only negative comment I have was around the breakfast.  The breakfast area is very small with no indoor seating and people kept taking food and going back to their rooms.  One visitor took the entire stock of Danimals yogurt and left none for any of the other guests.  The hotel staff was very accommodating and helpful.

Summary Heading: Did I stay the same place as the other reviewers?
Summary: This place was a disaster, except for Juan the desk clerk, who has the customer service skill to work at a 5 star hotel. 1) When we arrived they had no rooms for us because they are having computer problems with booking.com (we found out this isn't a first for them). Juan managed to scrounge up a room (one out of three) for us and found us rooms, free of charge at another nearby hotel. 2) When we returned to the hotel we couldn't check in because my daughter who made the reservation wasn't present, even though we hadn't paid for the rooms and had credit cards of our own to pay with (Juan was gone by now). Once my daughter arrived, the desk clerk attempted to charge us $200/night for rooms that were booked at $120/night. 3) The leaky toilet in my daughter's and son-in-law's room
Manager Response: 1.  Yes, indeed we were having "communication problems" with booking.com's 2way system with Best Western.  I understand that this is a stressful situation to walk into, and booking.com is working hard to fix this issue.  At the moment staff was aware of your booking they helped to the best of their abilities to find accommodations for the entire stay. 2.  Yes your are right we could of check you in with your information while the main party arrives to the hotel and exchanges the payment information.  I know now its a little late, i am very sorry.  We do have new staff in property and maybe we need to further our training.  The reason I see rooms were at higher rate, was because of the "communication problem" from booking.com.  If you experience different rate then the one booking.com gave you, please call me as soon as possible to have this fix.   3.  I checked the toilet, and seems maintenance already replaced the water filler pump. I really hope it wasn't a big inconvenience as i don't have any notes about the toilet.  I am sorry we dint see and or fix the problem before you guys checked in.  4.  I understand the frustration being on the third floor and not getting the elevator quickly. I want to apologize this incident happened during your stay but it does not happen often.  We have a service contract with "Executive Elevator" company and they do regular maintenance.  Also we call the company when there is an error or something out of normal is happening.  Front desk does notify the elevator company about the occurring problems and then they dispatch technician asap.  Elevator does get a lot usage and with time the buttons do wear off.  The elevator is properly working and no button issues.  5. Yes there is construction on the back lot, they don not use heavy machinery but do start working by 7 AM.   Management has been working with them, however they follow city guidelines.  Work stops like about 4 pm, so late night construction noise ..none.  I understand you were here for a weekend, Ball Rd can get really busy during the weekend and if you are light sleeper then yes you may need ear plugs. (if you are near the street)  I am sorry that we failed to find a better location for you.   I really feel that we deserve a higher than a 1 star, for our service.  If you can give us a chance to give you an outstanding stay experience please call the hotel directly.  Once again, thank you for the feedback as we use it to better ourselves.    Management

Summary: Small hotel in a great location that is right near parking at Disneyland.   Great service and speedy!   Nice room that was spacious and clean.  Parking was very tight and challenging.  Quiet hotel with a nice appearance.  Recommend this hotel fir all.

This hotel was an Excellent place to stay if you are visiting Disneyland! You can take the Tram to Disneyland which is very close to the hotel. The pool is very nice to use after a full day at Disney. The staff there is very good and friendly.

The first room we had was completely unacceptable. Smelled terrible, fridge was not working, toilet was running, tub regergatated black gunk. While we did get another room, this took time and we did not have time to go for dinner.

The smell from the bathroom was very unpleasant.  In addition, it smelled like cigarette smoke.  The TV remote did not work and the service person could not figure out how to make it work properly.  Service people were very nice.  The hotel needs to be renovated. Furniture was sticky - arms on chairs, handle on fridge... ICK!!
Manager Response: Dear Ms. Bridgett   Let me start by offering  my sincere apology for the negative in the room experience.  At our property we take a lot of pride on our work and try our best to meet every guest expectations.  In this case there was a lack on the effectiveness of our housekeeping department.  Management followed up with housekeeping department and proper actions were taken.  I do think we can do better. If you give us a second chance I can guaranteed a great stay.  Thank you again for your feed back!   Hotel Staff

Summary Heading: Great stay for our family of seven!
Summary: We did a 3 generation vacation with 4 nights here with adjoining rooms. The staff was very pleasant & accommodating, the breakfast was decent & a quick walk to the tram for Disneyland & California Adventure. Would definitely visit again!

On booking this hotel I didn't realise how close you are to the transport into Disney. Hotel to main gate 15 minutes that includes walking to the tram. Rooms great, staff fantastic and breakfast had enough choice to keep us going until lunch time.   I would not hesitate to stay here again or recommend it to others. A fantastic hotel.

We enjoy staying here when we go to Disneyland. It is a small hotel but the rooms are good sizes. The lobby can get congested in the mornings with the Disneyland guests getting their breakfast and the parking is limited on spaces. The rates are reasonable for the area and the hotel staff is very courteous.

Summary Heading: If you like noise---this IS the place for you!
Summary: If you are like my dad used to be and are not bothered by noise and traffic----you will love this place.  It also has such a tiny parking lot, there are times there are no parking spaces.  The breakfast ares is a joke with the worst coffee I may have ever had,  As far as Best Westerns go-----this is NOT one of their better properties.  Funny thing is----unlike other chains, if you are not satisfied, they only say sorry, but, never any type of compensation.
Manager Response: Dear Mr. Patrick   Thank you for your recent feedback regarding your stay at our property.  It looks like we failed to deliver and excellent stay.  I do want to apologize for not going beyond to make it as pleasant as possible for you.  It seems that you were assigned a room near the street.  Ball Rd during the week days is okay but during the weekends it can get a little loud.  I do understand you were here for business at the convention center? The parking on property is very limited but enough for registered guest to park in the lot.  However do run into situations when reservations drive in with multiple vehicles.  I am sorry about the inconvenience at this moment we are working with neighbors next door to minimize this scenarios for future guest.  Our breakfast area it is very small, however we are making changes in the near future to expand the sitting.  I do believe we can do better and if you can give us a second chance please call us directly to have better room location. And to further our conversation. Thank you again!   Hotel staff

Summary: Very nice hotel close to Disneyland, easy access to major highways.  Really nothing negative to report about our stay.  Rooms are nice size and the beds were comfortable.  The breakfast area inside is a little small, but they do offer outside areas so that helped a lot. The staff was very nice and helpful!   Not a lot of places to eat that are within walking distance, but we really didn't care about that option when we stayed.  Easy access to Disneyland parking shuttle.  About a 2 block walk to the parking garage where you can board the shuttle to the park, a few minutes and your at Disneyland!  I believe you can walk as well, I think it would take about 15-20 minutes.

This Best Western has free parking, free breakfast (with a pretty decent selection of breakfast items including waffles, sausages, breakfast sandwiches), and free Wi-Fi. And it's just right behind the Disney parking structure and a 5 minute walk to the Disney trams. What more could I ask? If you want a decent room with these free extras, and convenient to Disney, this is it. To top it off, they have the nicest staff.  Would definitely stay again.

We stayed here for a Disney trip. Our friend came with us, so we got the room with 3 queen beds so that she and our daughter didn't have to share a bed. Very reasonably priced. The breakfast was great - muffins, pastries, cereal, waffles, sausage, eggs, potatoes, yogurt, coffee, etc. Short walk to the Mickey and Friends parking lot tram. There was some construction happening behind us that started pretty early, but nothing too bad. We sleep with white noise running, so that helped. Stay here if you are looking for a cheap, clean place to stay for your Disney trip!

It was an okay stay, pricey for what it has to offer, however it works for a place to sleep in away from home, especially last minute planning. I'm sure there are other places that can provide more or look more pleasing for price... research before staying here. However if you are just staying here for the night, not too bad.

Summary Heading: Stayed the night while visiting Disneyland
Summary: The room was nice and comfortable. The one thing I will say that was lacking was enough parking. The nice thing was you can park your car and walk through Disneyland staff parking to get to the tram. Just make sure your good going up stairs. Otherwise enjoyed our stay

Excellent for access to Disney parks. Beds very comfy. Pretty loud place, bring earplugs to help with sleep.  If you're here for Disney, this place is perfect. If you're not, run away!  Closer to Disneyland than the Disney Paradise Pier Hotel - we easily came back for nap at lunch, then back to Disney for parades, fireworks. Decent to good breakfast included, as hotel bkfst goes. I'll come back when we're returning to the parks. This is a reasonable hotel in an expensive market.

Summary Heading: Excellent location for visiting Disneyland, Excellent Service
Summary: We enjoyed the stay in Best Western Courtesy Inn, Anaheim very much.   It is so close to the shuttle service of Disneyland,  The breakfast was wonderful.  The people at the reception and at serving the breakfast were all very kind.  The check-in and check-out service were very efficient.   The price was very reasonable.

Although parking is really tight at this property the stay was enjoyable. Staff was super friendly and helpful checking in. Rooms were nice, clean and comfortable. I would recommend this place if your looking for something nice and close by to Disneyland!

Just stayed for four nights at this motel, very good value. Staff exceptional especially Juan, helped us with any questions we had. Rooms were very nice although walls are very thin so advise that one brings ear plugs. No restaurants anywhere near so bring snacks if needed. Great accesability to the tram that takes you to Disneyland less than a five minute walk. Trams take only five minutes and are arriving every five to ten minutes. Fireworks were only one night of the four we were there but they were excellent, very loud.

After a bad expireience at a hotel across the way..i called this BWC Inn..I spoke to Genessis at the front desk...she was really polite and helpful in getting us the rooms that we needed.  I had my daughter and nephew and asked about the pool and she offered to let us stay another extra 1/2 hour.  Its staff like this that makes one want to come back - which we definatley will!!. Thank You again Genessis!

Stayed here a couple of times when visiting Disneyland. Great price, and walking distance from parking structure. Breakfast was included-Eggs waffles etc. Great for the budget conscious from small to large families.

We stayed at this hotel for three nights because it was the closest to DisneyLand. The hotel is very convenient if traveling in a budget. Breakfast is really good, they serve eggs, bread, sausage, baked potatoes, waffles, coffee, and orange juice, which is included. The front desk people are very helpful specially Alexis, who made sure we had everything we needed.

Stayed here for 3 nights with 2 kids (9 and 13 yrs old). Perfect location for Disney--you walk 5 min. to the Disney & Friends tram, without even crossing a street, and then 5 min tram ride to the entrance. The room was tastefully remodeled, and the staff was super friendly. (Ana went out of her way to make us feel welcome upon check in  and another staff member delivered blankets in about 2 min when we requested them). The pool and jacuzzi were great for a nighttime dip after a long day at Disney. The free breakfast included eggs, sausage, waffle maker, fresh fruit, etc.  The only downside was occasional noise (sirens, Disney fireworks, voices outside the door), but this is typical for hotels in this price range, and we were interested in spending more time at Disney than the

I had booked this hotel months in advance of our trip, and in between had seen some poor reviews and mentions of roaches. We had considered switching, but decided against it. And I can honestly say I'm glad we didn't! The staff was great, our room was always clean (and bug free- I inspected thoroughly) and well stocked. The free breakfast was exactly what we needed and we actually preferred taking it back to our room to get ready while the kids ate. The walk to and from the tram was easy and quick - even with three kids in tow.

This hotel needs a complete re-furbishing job from top to bottom! Guest room is way below any motel standard and smells. Carpet needs steam cleaning. Walls needs cleaning and or painting. Bath room sink and shower drains needs flush down with drain cleaner to get rid of order. Guest room lighting are mixed with warm to cool white bulbs and very dim. Only one miserable sink and at times it backs up with smelly black water...

The staff was friendly, professional, and helpful.  The room appeared clean and inviting.  Nothing overly fancy.  During our stay, the bed was made but not fresh linens each day.  There are signs of the hotel being worn but overall, was not a bad place to stay for the price.  A good location to Disneyland park.  The kitchenette where breakfast is served is a bit cramped, but the food was decent.  Construction on motel next door started at 7am sharp.  The heating unit was a bit loud during the night.

Summary Heading: Fantastic Location - easy & quick walk to Disney trams
Summary: Great location if you're going to Disneyland, CA Adventure or Downtown Disney. It's about a 3 minute walk to the Disney parking structure, then 5 minute walk through it, and out to the tram. Room was decent enough with a comfy bed. Free breakfast was not the greatest, but it's Best Western and it was free. Soda and snack vending machines on site. Mini fridge, microwave, and coffee maker in room. Free wifi. Good price too - about $105 a night including all the taxes & fees.

Summary Heading: Easy walk to Disney. Fair price. Clean and friendly.
Summary: Just back from a quick trip to Disney. Booked this hotel as a last minute change from the Anaheim Maingate across the street(don't stay there!) Best Western was clean and the staff are SUPER friendly.  Parking is a bit limited. We have a big truck we were worried we wouldn't be able to park since we arrived at 1am, but the clerk moved his car into the smaller available space so we could park in the larger one. Never used the pool or hot tub since it was cold(January) but watched the fireworks from there. The fireworks are set off right behind the hotel in the Disney employee lot so they are LOUD! Sets off car alarms but mostly just in the employee lot. Our alarm never went off. The view of the fireworks is great. The breakfast is better than most. Instead of just wrapped muffins

We stayed 3 nights-room was nothing ritzy,but clean.Staff was very nice,breakfast was okay. The hotel is located near Disneyland,Honda Civic Center and Angels Stadium are 10-15 minutes by car. The only negative thing:the room was very poorly soundproofed,although it's right next to the street.When an ambulance or the police passed by I thought they were driving through the room.

The room was not extravagant, but it was spacious and clean. It was an improvement over our stay at a Ramada in Burbank and an independent hotel in Monterey the previous 2 nights.  We were shocked the first night there. It is fairly close to Disneyland as the nightly fireworks set off car alarms in the parking lot.  It is close to a 20 minute walk to the gate to enter Disney parks. Only 15 from Downtown Disney. It takes 20 minutes but most of it is one one street. The hotel is only one block away before you turn down the street that takes you into Downtown Disney. The parking would be a bit tight if the hotel was fully booked.Thankfully it was not as we were there in the off season.  The staff at the hotel were all very good to deal with, both the front desk and the breakfast

Hotel was average and within walking distance to Disneyland. Problem is parking. Not enough spaces for amount of rooms. Spaces they did have were for compact cars. Vehicles were double-parked; ridiculous. If you drive a truck, don't go here.

Summary Heading: The Staff Make this place memorable!!!
Summary: Hotel is fine and located nicely. While not new, it was adequate for the mid-range casual stay. What makes it outstanding is staff like the manager, Juan and the gal that works the breakfast nook each morning.....Sonja. These two were outstandingly good and that's why I remember their names. They are a credit to the property and made me and my wife's week stay extremely pleasant!!! Thank you Juan and Sonja!!!

We booked this hotel sight unseen but were pleasantly surprised   by our experience. It is an older, basic style hotel, but is set apart by its fabulous staff, who could not have been more polite, helpful or efficient.  The hotel is fabulously located, only a couple of minutes walk to the disney tram stop...very convenient at the end of a long day.  And watching the Disney fireworks from the hot-tub was an unexpected and happy surprise.

The hotel is very good kept up to date! The staff is amazing and go the extra mile to make costumer have a nice relaxing stay.  Very short walk to the tram.  The free breakfast is great! Scramble eggs, sausage links, and potatoes, waffles, fresh fruit! A lot to choose from.  Thank you all for doing a great job, we will be back again! and again!

We stayed here specifically for it's short access to DisneyLand Trams.  It was an easy 5 minute walk with 2 small children.  The room served it's purpose, it was clean and everything worked.  We stayed 2 nights and utilized the beds, shower and breakfast, it was great for us!  We were able to watch the fireworks by the pool.   My only complaint is there was construction on the lot behind us and they started both mornings at 7a on the dot.  It would have been nice to know about upon check in.

We stayed here the night before we went to Disneyland. We choose this hotel due to its location to Disneyland and the the ease of getting into the park. The rooms are average size and and everything worked. It would have been nice if there were more plugs for charging phones but this is a problem with most all hotels. The parking lot is small and the vehicles are packed in  everywhere they can be. The breakfast bar was small and limited in choices. We didn't use the internet so I can't comment on that.

I chose this motel because they listed the chance to buy Disneyland tickets and at a cheaper price.  When we got there we found out they don't sell the tickets.  We had to wait in line and pay full price.  I could have at least save the wait in line time by buying them at a store first before we got there.  It's a horrible ploy  to get people to stay there.!!!

Great little Anaheim gem! This hotel is great it's a short distance from Disneyland. I've heard you can walk from the hotel grounds to Disneyland we chose to take our car and it's about a 5-7 min drive.   Everyone is very friendly, the rooms are clean, and overall its just a great place to stay.

Summary Heading: Excellent Choice for easy access to Disneyland
Summary: When I booked this room, I was looking for a reasonable price, free parking, good ratings, breakfast included and short walking distance to the parks.  I got all this for a great price!  We were very pleased with the quality of the room and the friendliness of the staff.  We also loved the fact that it was only a 5-10 minute walk to the Disney Tram, where we caught a ride to the parks everyday.  It made it so nice to be able to come back to the room to rest or use the pool in the middle of the day.  We also loved watching the fireworks from the hot tub, most every night!  Big Bonus for all of us!  Thanks for the fresh fruit (strawberries and blueberries) every morning.  Nice addition to our breakfast.

Hotel was clean, staff was very friendly, and given the close proximity o the hotel to the par, the price was very reasonable.  Staff was very helpful with anything we needed.  Even upon departure, the staff wanted to make sure that if we needed anything else to eat or to take food to the airport with us just ask as our departure time was an early one.

Summary Heading: Small hotel, big value, nice, clean, good breakfast
Summary: Surprising good bargain. Small place, big on service. Breakfast was very good, waffles, eggs, sausage, potatoes, bread, muffins, pastry, cereal, beverages...all really good. Room had fridge, microwave, coffee maker, iron, wireless, big TV...really nice, excellent value.

There was a certain person, we didn't interact with anyone heavily, just the overall experience went nice & quite with no problem, i.e. Smooth check in & Check Out Clean Room Speed internet Breakfast on time The Reception Guy help us to have to go to Disney Discounted Ticket & show us a shortcut to walk to Disney. - It was a very nice experience and the hotels it's 2 min away from Disneyland and in a very decent place. The Breakfast area was very small, it accommodate 3 tables only, so we usually have to wait for an empty table. - We spent the whole day out & go to sleep. - 45 min from Universal Studios - I think in the busy days there will be a parking issue & place for breakfast - Overall, very good value for money

Summary Heading: Just a block away from the Disneyland Parking Lot Tram
Summary: The best part of this hotel was how easy it was to get to and from Disneyland. It's just a block from the Mickey and Friends Parking Lot. Just a short walk through the lot and you can take the tram to  Downtown Disney. The overall walk is about the same as if you stayed at the Disneyland Hotel. Also, the security line on this side of the park is much faster than on the "Maingate" side of the park. Each afternoon we were able to head back to the hotel to drop any purchases, charge up our phones (or cameras), and change clothes for the cooler temperatures. We were refreshed and back to the park within an hour. Breakfast nook is very cramped so plan on eating in the outdoor area or your room. Grab food early!!

This a great inexpensive place too layover and make your disney stay a multi day event.  On the shuttle route so you can leave your vehicle there.  Watch the fireworks from the spa a the hotel.  The bed was soon comfortable.  Friendly and accommodating staff and a great breakfast.  You will enjoy this hotel

We initially were put into room 201, the floors were sticky, room smelled like carpet deodorizer. I could taste it in my mouth. On day 3 the ceiling came down in the bathroom, mold/mildew was exposed. Luckily we came back from Disneyland around 9 and was able to move our belongings to room 202 (they had saved us that room due to ceiling, however didn't notify us by phone during the day). Room 202 did not have the smell, but again the tile floor was sticky, fridge had a humming sound, and the next morning, there was a roach in our left overs that was placed in the fridge. The Manager didn't seem to care much when I brought the issue to him. I can definitely say I would never recommend this BW to friends/strangers/family. I have been a guest to other BW's in the past, this has to
Manager Response: Hi Ms. Lydia,  I want to thank you for your survey.  I want to apologize for not exceeding your expectations.  I read your reviews and it was stated that the room was not up to your standards.  The room that was originally booked for you was affected by the upstairs plumbing , when guest used bathroom. The staff was not aware of the plumbing incident until housekeeping maid service your room.  At that moment (2pm) staff called plumber however do to the hour they couldn't make it on time.  The other option was to move rooms and staff held next door room for you.  The next day you brought  up to my attention about the bug sighting,  I immediately mention that we will have to call my exterminator to inspect and service your room (isotech). You asked me to wait until you check out.  I offered you the reports of that inspection if requested.  For the plumbing inconvenience the staff gave you compensation and apologized.  At the Best Western Courtesy Inn we care about our guest and staff, we continually do preventative maintenance in all rooms and public areas.  I can assure you this was an isolated case and it is not a problem at the hotel.  I will be happy to provide any information or documents requested.  If I can assist you any further please give me a call directly at 714-772-2470  Management

Summary: We came to CA to visit Disneyland and take part in a running adventure.  This hotel was perfect for the budget minded traveler and was so close to DL.    We arrived late (like after midnight late) to the hotel and the night auditor/reception Tony was there to great us.  He had a great smile on his face and made us feel so welcome.  Tony got us checked in and answered all our first time visitor questions.   The hotel is older but is well kept.  If you are looking for 5 star with all the amenities, you should look elsewhere but if you are looking for comfort on a budget, this is your place. Genesis was also great with our check out process.   The rooms are partially updated but the beds are super comfortable.  There's a microwave, refrigerator and coffee pot, everything you need

We stayed at another BW in San Diego and my entire family had severe allergic reactions to the products.  We thought it was a one off, but once again that occurred at this hotel.  Never happened in the past, so something in the chain has changed.  We won't be able to stay at BW again.
Manager Response: Hello,  Thank you for completing the survey on your recent stay at the Best Western Courtesy Inn.  I want to apologized for not exceeding your expectations.  I do not recall seen any notes on this incident, It looks like it was only mentioned when checked out.  The chemicals we used to service our rooms are provided by company ECOLAB.  I am sorry that it may have caused a skin reaction, this is the first time this case happens.  I contacted my ECOLAB representative and made appointment  to discuss this matter. I cannot comment on the previous Best Western as each is independently owned and operated. I do apologized for the bad experience and if I can assist you any further please give me a call any time at 714-772-2470  Management

Summary Heading: Customer Service , Location  Make this Very Good !!
Summary: We arrived very early prior to check in the guy at the front desk was so helpful, He allowed us a place to change , switched our rooms so we could check in early, We really just wanted to utilize the pool before our Disneyland Days. Room was clean, refrigerator, microwave, I liked the smell of the soap.. LOL. Usually I don't like hotel soaps.  Location, well Honestly first of all, somebody mentioned you can see fireworks, and boy can you , we sat in the hot tub and had a beautiful firework show.. I think better than at Disneyland .   Its a little bit of a walk to the trams but really not much at all, I loved that we could eat and walk a 5 minute walk and be at the Trams.  We had no problems with parking, Breakfast, had what you needed, sausage, eggs, potatoes, waffle maker,

Summary Heading: Short walk to the Disneyland Tram
Summary: This hotel is a nice place to stay. Parking can be an issue but it is free. The location to the Disneyland Tram is why we stay here. Only 2 blocks to the Mickey and Friends parking garage, go through the garage and the tram is right there.

For one night it was ok as we only wanted to sleep there and have a short walk to Disneyland. But the hotel wasn't in good shape. It took us two times of calling a employee to fix have a warm shower and it smelled not good, when we turned on the heating. The breakfast was very simple but ok. The doors are so thin, that you hear everything from people walking around. Finally it was for us the best match of rent and distance to Disneyland

We stayed here for two nights while we visited the local parks. The room was clean and had a microwave and refrigerator, which we used. The decor of the room is a little tired but we only needed the room to sleep after long days at the park. The beds had plenty of pillows and overall were just fine. The bathroom counter had plenty space for our toiletries and the shower had great water pressure. The parking lot is small but we did not have any issues. The noise from the main street is audible but after a day at the park we fell right to sleep. The breakfast in the morning was a great amenity. We will definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Good Place to stay near Disneyland
Summary: This Best Western is within a very short walk to the Disneyland trolley. They have a very good breakfast, but it is a small room. I suggest taking it back to your room. Room was clean and the desk and breakfast people were very cordial. Parking lot is small but adequate. Be ready to enjoy the fireworks from Disneyland each evening. The first night I thought they were right over my head when I went to bed early. The nice thing is that it is a very short walk to the Disneyland parking structure and the view from the top floor is spectacular. Bring your camera.

I must say i am very impressed with this Inn. The rooms are clean the staff are amazing very good location to Disney. The prices are very good. I only wish the breakfast was a little better they have it in a small room and not up to the standards of other best westerns. Over all a great place to stay I give the staff and rooms 5 stars. Thank you for a very nice visit.

This a great, great hotel. It's clean, the staff was super friendly, and it's only a 5 minute walk to the trams that take you to Disneyland. The first night we were there we watched the Disneyland fireworks from the pool area and it was a fantastic view! Breakfast was pretty good, nothing to write home about but a nice variety. My only complaint is with the  free wi-fi: the service is horrible! Only my daughter was able to connect her cell phone to the internet and that was in the hotel parking lot! Other than that, we really enjoyed our stay and will definitely stay here again the next time we visit Disneyland.

Summary Heading: The best way to visit Disneyland
Summary: This Best Western was a great way to visit Disneyland. A very short walk brought us to the tram system, so we could avoid driving to the park. The hotel service and staff were excellent. We will definitely stay here again.

Located just around the corner of Disneyland, walking distance, very friendly and helpful staff and good amenities, safe, a good price and place to stay for a few days visiting Disneyland parks. Pool, spa, breakfast, parking, staff assistance, it was as good as it gets

This hotel met all of our needs during our vacation to Disneyland.  It was a mere 5 minute walk to the Disney Mickey and Friends Tram which was extremely convenient.  The rooms were clean, well-kept and comfortable.  The breakfast offered the traditional continental offerings of cold and hot choices, but variety among items was at a bare minimum. The outdoor pool, though small, offered a nice break and was clean and welcoming.   Be well advised that currently the adjoining property is undergoing construction which greatly interferes with parking on the premises.  There is nowhere close to enough parking spaces per available rooms causing serious double parking throughout our stay.  Also because of the construction, the route to the Disney Tram can be blocked off and

Great value for the room and service.  Parking not great but staff very willing to make things work.  Clean rooms.  Easy tram ride to Disneyland.  However if you want to eat you must take your car because there is not anything around the hotel to walk to.

Summary Heading: Cheap and close to the park.
Summary: Decent walk to Disneyland with the option of hopping on the Disney parking lot tram (free).  The hotel offers free breakfast and parking which is a huge savings.  Breakfast was ok, I would recommend making a waffle and having some yogurt.  The room was very basic and clean (decent toiletry items).  My only issue was the first night we checked in, we went to bed sort of early (~9pm) and were awaken by the Disneyland fireworks going off.  The fireworks lasted about half an hour.  It was VERY loud.  Also the room had a window air conditioner (in the wall) and it allowed a lot of outside nice into the room (street traffic and construction).

I'll be honest, I wasn't really expecting too much from this place, we had a 2 day stay here whilst visiting Disneyland and it was just a place to sleep and shower. I must say though, I was surprised at the quality of the room, it was clean, comfortable and spacious. The breakfast bar and the amenities on hand were also very good. The staff were polite, courteous and friendly. The location of the hotel is so close to Disneyland; a 5-10 minute walk to the tram stop and then onto Disneyland from there, there's shopping and restaurants nearby, and it's very decently priced! I couldn't believe our luck in finding this place! Thank you for a wonderful stay and being apart of our most memorable trip to the Happiest Place on Earth!

This hotel is a perfect location to both parks. A short one block walk to the tram from the hotel. The staff are extremely friendly.  The breakfast is not the greatest however, it is very consistent and again, the staff is very friendly.  I would downgrade the hotel just based on age however it is very clean.

Juan, the hotel manager and his staff made our honeymoon vacation a very memorable experience, We spent one day at Disneyland and one day at California Adventures, and this location was ideal. We were on foot and did not have to walk far to get to the disney parks, stores and restaurants.

Love this place, it is so close to Disneyland you can walk to the park. If you can't be in the park when the fireworks go off, the next best place to watch them is in the hot tub, what a great view. The staff is great. The rooms are nice and the price is fair.

quaint little BW right next to Disney. right beside is the parking lot which has trams that take you right to the gate,.. no walking.  Room was clean, and spacious even with kids. Breakfast was really quite good with scrambled eggs, real potatos, sausages, belgian waffles with fresh strawberries, fruit, juice coffee, and an assortment of continental items and cereals. The pool is refreshing with salt water chlorination so its easier on your skin. The hot tub is large and cozy. Both are seldom used it seems. Great location to view the fireworks. Excellent value,

Summary Heading: Good hotel for those wanting no frills with clean room
Summary: Stayed here for a business conference.  It was adequate; no bells and whistles.  Cute small pool.  Close proximity to Disneyland.  Would probably be good for someone who wants to make a trip to Disneyland and not spend a fortune.

No complaints about the room, close enough to Disneyland to walk (although it is a bit of a workout with the hills), but also just down the street from the Mickey Friends parking structure if you prefer to park.  The Disneyland fireworks go off right behind the hotel, so you have a great view with no sound delay if you are at your room during that time.  Breakfast is not as good as most Best Westerns, but still pretty good.  Rooms were very clean, no issues with any of the facilities and the internet was fast.

Summary Heading: Good sums up the overall stay
Summary: We stayed here for just under a week at the end of September, they were very helpful in accommodating us to extend and stay in the same room. Breakfast was supplied and had a good range, there is a fridge and microwave in the room to help keep costs down. The floor coverings in the room need to be shampooed or changed as after showering we always ended up with black feet (took a little bit to work out why). Watching the fire works from the street and pool was very much enjoyed from our girls. Overal was a good stay.

It's not the biggest hotel in the world, but was very pleased with my stay. It was a very nice, quiet place to come back to after being at Disneyland all day (well, mostly quiet. Disneyland fireworks finale rattled the room). Breakfast was a lot more than expected when I first saw the breakfast area. Quite a large variety to choose from. Parking lot was a little on the small side, but overall was very pleased with the stay.

Summary Heading: Advertised as easy access to Disneyland-not
Summary: There are better locations in Anaheim to visit Disneyland.  Travelers walk to the Disneyland parking garage and are required to walk up stairs to the second floor and then across the garage to escalators to take  trams to go the parks.  It could take an hour after the park closes to get back to this location. This is not easy for people that are using strollers with young children or any travelers that could have trouble climbing stairs.  We will not stay at this motel again.  The breakfast trays were sticky and access in the area was tight.  We had many issues staying here, however, as we were packing to leave, we saw cockroaches in our room which was the straw that broke the camels back.
Manager Response: Hi Robert,  On behalf of our entire team I would like to apologize for not exceeding your expectations.  The information about distance to the park is accurate, however it does take a little longer for families traveling with young infants and or elderly guest.  I was not aware of cockroaches in room complaint, but I assure you this is not a problem here in the hotel. We have a contract agreement with exterminator company ISOTECH, and they come every month to service the entire hotel for prevention. I will also contact them and have them inspect thoroughly the room for any traces or signs of bugs.  Once I get the report I can forward that via email or fax for your records.  I will contact you once I get the report and see how we can follow up.   Once again I apologize and hope you give us a chance to make it up to you in the near future.  Thank you and have an excellent day.   Management

Summary: We had a good stay.  Loved the location, hated the parking lot.  The room was clean and VERY spacious.  If I had only one complaint, it would be pool hours.  We attempted to use the pool at 8am and were told the pool did not open until 10am.  Which, on one-hand I understand, for noise control, but I wish there would have been something else to entertain my 11 month old with.  Game room, larger lounge area, etc

Great Location for you get to see the smiling and happy faces of Disney land employees as they cut through the BW parking lot as they go to and from work. I felt just as happy as the Disney employees during my stay at Best Western Courtesy Inn.

Summary Heading: Our second stay here and still our first choice!
Summary: Ok, if you're looking at Best Westerns you're looking at saving a little cash right? Otherwise you'd be staying IN the park.  Like us you're probably looking for a quiet place to lay your head after exhausting yourself in Disneyland. We have found this motel to be the answer to all our needs.   Free parking. If you do all your driving and running around to Target early in the day you'll have a parking spot when you return. Later may require a little jockeying around.   When you get in your room you'll have to turn on the AC because the maids keep it off when no one is in the room. Our AC worked fine, quiet enough to run on "low cool" all night long. Same with the fridge. You might have to turn it on upon arrival, little black button is on the back interior wall of the fridge.

Summary Heading: Great Value and within Walking Distance to Disneyland Resort
Summary: I was surprised at the quality of this hotel considering the value price withing such a close proximity to the Disneyland Resort. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable and included a microwave and refrigerator.  The parking lot is a little small and the continental breakfast is fairly small but okay for a quick muffin and coffee.

This motel was very close to Disneyland and the Disneyland Hotel where we ran one of the Disney 1/2 Marathons and 10K races. It was within walking distance and very affordable for the nearness to Disneyland. Our group all stayed at this Best Western yet we all had our own space in that we rented 3 separate rooms.

The only comments we had was that breakfast was just okay; it would benefit from a space that isn't the check in desk and with more choice/variety. The hot tub the first night was a great temperature but another night we went in and it wasn't very warm. But it was a pretty good location, easy to get to the park. All you needed to do was walk through the parking o the tram and it was a few minute tram ride to the gate. We really enjoyed our room (the bed was extremely comfortable, and the room and service was great) and stay.

Summary Heading: A Secret Passage to the Magic
Summary: We are big fans of Disneyland.  We like to stay within walking distance of the park.  We have stayed at most of them.  And this hotel is our new favorite.  The hotel is at or above Best Western standards.   But the number one reason we like this hotel is the passageway to the park.  there is a back walkway that leads to the parking structure and then to the trams.  This makes the actual walking distance shorter than most of the other hotels.   A clean room, free breakfast, and the secret passage makes for happy customers.

We had a one night stay here as last minute. The room was clean and we liked that! Pillows a bit hard for my pillow taste. Pool was great and we could see the fireworks. The hot tub had a bit too much chlorine to the point that i had to get out. Also they did not have towels in the pool area even though they had a section for them. The staff was really nice though! My son spilled some juice in the breakfast area and they were really nice about it and cleaned it immediately. It can get a bit loud in the mornings with kids outside but overall we would stay here again!

very friendly staff nice clean hotel very close to disneyland short walk to free shuttle saw fireworks from room window good breakfast selection had a fridge and microwave  have 2 grandchildren 2 and 5 very kid friendly

Summary Heading: Amazing hotel, great staff, family friendly
Summary: My family had an amazing experience.  We arrived early and staff had a room ready for us. The walk to the tram is very short.. breakfast was good but would preffered scramble eggs and potatoes.  The only problem was the parking, but staff made it easy to find one for us. Thanks  for all the help!!!

We always stay here when we go to Disneyland. Its a great value and a short walk to Disney and Friends parking lot for the shuttle. We often wear earplugs at night because Ball Rd is pretty busy all the time - but they cant help that at the hotel.

Try and get a corner room.  They are bigger.  Parking is very limited but they will park your car if they need to double park cars.  Breakfast is weak - cereal, waffle, packaged sausage sandwich, juice, coffee, small packaged muffins etc.  No seating in breakfast area and they allow you to bring it back to your room.  Walk to Disneyland is simple if you go through the disney parking structure and use the tram.

My home away from home. Stay here every time we go to Disneyland. convenient, affordable, clean, warm....what a great view of the Disneyland fireworks show right from the pool. Thank you Best Western...

The experience here was less than satisfactory for many reasons. Firstly when we arrived with our rental car at about 4pm– tired after a 15 ½ hour flight and the need to fill in the day till check in time at 3pm, we were astounded to find the hotel completely roped off with no way in. Seems the carpark which was being re-surfaced that day but there was no signage or anything else to tell us how to get in,  or where to park. After double parking outside the hotel (there’s a huge construction site next door) we were finally given vague instructions to park half a mile or so down the road with no offer of help with luggage etc. We were lucky enough to avoid this as we found ourselves a spot opposite the hotel & managed to get across the road & the newly surfaced car park to

Location very good - near Disneyland, 10 minutes walk. the hotel is ok for sleeping and run to Disney.  Price is OK, Breakfast OK.  I do not have 200 Char...Use these 150... I do not have 200 Char...Use these 150...

Summary Heading: Don't bother. Stay on the other side.
Summary: Poor to non existent housekeeping. Had to call 2 days in a row for clean towels and to empty the garbage. It is not .4 miles from Disneyland, it was over 1 mile walk each way! Breakfast was ok for being included. Beds were fine and sheets were clean.
Manager Response: Dear Donna Phelps,  Thank you for completing the survey. On behalf of our entire team, I would like to apologize for not exceeding your expectations.  Your satisfaction is important to us and we will be using the feedback you gave us to implement improvements to ensure we offer a better experience for guests in the future.   I hope that you will consider staying with us again so that we can have another chance to provide you with a superior experience.   If I can provide any assistance, please don't hesitate to contact me directly at 714-772-2470.  Sincerely,  Management BEST WESTERN Courtesy Inn

Summary Heading: Nice stay at Best western Courtesy inn
Summary: Everything wen real nice and easy since check in to check out. the best location nearby Disney parking area which is a value added. Breakfast very complete, Room pretty clean, maybe just to change shower controls,

Summary Heading: Great for the price but not a comfortable place to stay
Summary: We booked this hotel based on the location (near Disney and the Anaheim Convention Center).  The rooms were in decent shape but the beds were very uncomfortable.  The front desk staff were friendly and very helpful but the breakfast bar was shut down early every morning.  We had kids who wanted to eat waffles but it was removed from the kitchen area before we made it downstairs every morning.  The pool was very small and the hot tub didn't appear to be clean.  I would recommend staying here if you are on a tight budget but not if you want to get a good nights sleep.

AMAZING VALUE!! I stayed here on the 29th of July, the location was absolutely perfect for the theme parks, Disney is just a 5min walk away. The rooms were very clean, tidy, modern, quiet, and incredibly spacious. The breakfast was good, the reception staff were very friendly and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel for value!

Overcrowded parking lot. Had to use valet parking and got double parked in. Thin walls, cars and neighbors are very loud. Almost too far to walk to Disney. Park Place Best Western is a much better option.

Summary Heading: Nice place, great price, short walk to trams.
Summary: We stayed here during a recent trip to Disneyland. It was a short walk through the Disneyland parking garage to the trams which drop you off at Downtown Disney. Total travel time to the parks' entrances is 10-15 minutes if you catch the 1st or 2nd tram. You might end up waiting at the tram turnaround if you go later in the day though.  An important note: The walk through the parking garage to the trams is NOT ADA accessible There is a flight and a half of stairs required. This might pose difficulties with large strollers as well.  The hotel itself was really nice and clean every day. The breakfast is simple, pre-packaged muffins, small milk cartons, cereal, fresh fruit, etc. Nothing extraordinary, but just right to grab-and-go.  Parking is free which is something I always look

I have stayed at multiple Best Westerns before but this hotel shouldn't be allowed to keep the brand name. I just recently stayed at this Hotel and I wish I hadn't.  The only reason we stayed here was its close proximity to Disneyland and the fact they are one of the few hotels who state they have free parking.  Well the parking is free but good luck getting a spot.  There are around 39 rooms in this hotel and there are only about 20 parking spots.  3 of these spots will cause you to be double parked.  Parking was a complete joke.  The front desk said that you could park behind someone and just leave the keys at the desk.  What? This is not a valet service and why would I give my keys to a front desk clerk.  Another kicker is that the employees also park in this lot and they

Stayed here for a night at Disney. Great location, but feels like a dirty room. Bathroom was very out of date and the towels were dirty before we used them.   Friendly front desk clerk, but rooms could use some real cleaning up. Great location, but I don't think I would stay again.

We chose this hotel primarily because it was a Best Western and close to Disney. A short walk to the trams that take you right to Downtown Disney and the main entrances to Disneyland and California Adventure. A little tip though, get your Disney passes on-line because the hotel doesn't always have them on hand. We were there in July and they had already sold out. Not a big deal though.

Summary Heading: GREAT STAFF, GREAT ROOM AWESOME PRICE!
Summary: My stay was great! all staff was helpful and went above and beyond to make my stay enjoyable. I really love the distance to Disneyland's tram.  Thank you and now I know where to stay next time I come to town.

I like this hotel. I stayed here before and I liked it that is why I returned to stay here. It has very easy access to go to Disneyland. The morning breakfast was good. Gas stations, grocery stores and restaurants are very close by, like less then a mile.

Summary Heading: Scammers called room to get credit card into
Summary: Noisy air conditioner, toilet running/flushing by itself. Scammers call rooms at 6AM trying asking for name, address and credit card info to re-enter into reservation computer. The hotel is in a great location next to Disneyland. The room's utilities are old and in need of replacement. It is clean and the staff friendly.

staff were exceptionally good. near to Disney trams (from parking lot) .Breakfast quality is not that great . do not bank upon that too much.  Allowed us to park even after checkout . saved us the parking fees .

Close to Disneyland, the Happiest place on Earth! Walk thru the parking lot and you are there. There is a variety of items for breakfast that you can choose from that will satisfy the entire family. If family members are tired they can go back to the hotel and rest then return to the park. Everything was very accommodating. The only concern was the lack of parking since we arrived late at night but the office provided a spot for us.

Summary Heading: Great hotel! free tram to disney nearby!!!
Summary: My family and I had a great stay at this best western.  Free transportation to Disney was awesome.  Short walk to the tram and they take u to the front entrance.  Overall a nice hotel to visit Disney.  Limited parking only bad thing.

We had a great time staying here.  We could walk to the Disneyland tram.  It was more convenient than when we stayed at the hotels across the street from Disneyland.  The rooms were clean and mostly well-maintained.  The bathroom had a bit of mold because of no ventilation and it was noisy the first night when our neighbor took a shower at 1AM, but after that it was as if we were the only ones there.  As a bonus, we loved having three beds.  We have a family of 5.

Nice place to stay for the money. Has a elevator for easy access to all 3 floors. Decent parking lot however the lot was full to the point that my car was blocked in by an illegal parker. Breakfast is acceptable and included with the cost of the room. No additional cost for parking. Esay walk to the tram for Disney which is just around the corner from the hotel.

Although this hotel is off the beaten track, it is actually a short walk to the front gate of Disneyland.  That's because there is a walkway from the hotel to the tram station at the Disneyland parking structure.  That makes this hotel a very convenient choice when visiting Disneyland.   We really enjoyed or stay.  The room were clean and quiet.  The staff was courteous and helpful.   The only drawback is that the parking area is extremely small.  This was no problem for our Prius, but if you have a large vehicle, it might be a problem.  We will definitely keep this hotel in mind the next time we visit Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Ok rooms with easy Disney access
Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights for a short Disney holiday and overall were happy with the accomodations.  Pros: Best thing about this place is the location: A short walk to the parking structure trams that take you right to the Disney gates.  I don't know how this compares to other hotels around Disney as this is our first time visiting. The heated pool and hot tub were a welcome retreat after a long day of park walking and were always clean. The room itself was also clean with nice bedding. The price: One of the cheapest hotels around Disney  Cons: The shower temperature was eradicate and the controls confusing (label said pull to turn on but you had to turn it, hot was on the right, not the left, etc).  We sometimes had to wait 5 minutes to get just luke-warm water with the

The breakfast was very good with several options. They had good options of food for young children. You can walk right through the Disney parking structure and hop on the tram to Downtown Disney. It's about a .03 mile walk.

This was my second stay at this Best Western, but my first during a very busy weekend, and the lack of parking was painfully obvious from the moment I drove in to register. The clerk suggested I double park behind another car (!), but offered to move his own vehicle when I refused. By night fall many cars were double parked. Glad I was able to secure a decent single space at check in and thankful I did not have to move my car during my stay as we were able to walk to Disneyland from this motel. Good location--bad parking.

Summary Heading: CLEAN ROOMS! FRIENDLY STAFF!! FREE BREAKFAST!
Summary: My family and I enjoyed the location and the breakfast waffles were so good! The hotel provides  (ok) breakfast , WIFI, free parking , staff is so great with costumers. At check out they let me park my vehicle few hours so we can enjoy our last day at Disney without having to pay for parking! Thank you! we will be back!

There were good things about this hotel and one really bad thing. I'll start with the good; the location is ideal for Disneyland and Downtown Disney. All you do is walk through the cast member parking lot, through the parking structure, and bam, you're at the Tram that takes you to Disneyland and Downtown Disney! It took us about 15 minutes to get to Disneyland's front gate. If you want to walk around Downtown Disney after the tram stops, it is a little bit of walk back to the hotel, but not too bad, probably about 2 miles and a safe walk through Downtown Disney and the parking lots. The staff at the hotel was very nice; they allowed us to take advantage of a late check-out, which really helped out. The complimentary breakfast was yummy, included cereal, waffle maker, fruit,

We have stayed here before and really loved it.  The rooms were clean, the service was great and it was a very short walk to the free tram that takes you to Disneyland.  We also really appreciated the free breakfast as it was basically a continental breakfast but they also had breakfast sandwiches that you heated in the microwave, so it was a substantial breakfast before heading out to the parks for the day.  But this time we had a couple of little problems.  The first day we came back to our room and the towels had been taken away, but not replaced and nothing had been cleaned up in the room such as beds made, trash removed etc.  We call the front desk and they promptly brought up towels, but explained that they do not make the beds but would do the trash and vacuum.  It seemed

Summary Heading: Great Location! Great staff! good Value!
Summary: Hotel is great! My family had a great time!  Helpful staff and clean rooms! I didn't have no problems while staying there.  The road it can get a little noisy but for us was not a problem.  We got a corner room which it was bigger than the others I think... It was perfect for my two kids to run around :)

From the moment we arrived until we left we only encountered wonderful and courteous service from the entire staff.  We were allowed to have a early check-in around 2pm which really helped with our day.  The location of this hotel is perfect for a Family vacation to Disneyland.  We had 2 rooms.  Parking was never a problem.  Our rooms were clean and well maintained. Beds were very comfortable.  Only a short walk to the Disneyland Tram, which made it easy to come and go during the day if you needed to rest.  Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone needing a clean, convenient and great hotel employee service.  We even watched the Disney fireworks from the hotel pool/spa! Loved our stay here!  Will return here for our next Disney Family Vacation!

We enjoy the hotel, the breakfast was good, the location is really convenience all the employee were really friendly. Really close to Disneyland, the front gave us direction and les than 10 minutes from the hotel.

I picked this hotel after reading other reviews and found it to be perfect for family on a budget that still wants amenities. It had nice and clean rooms, heated pool and hot tub, and warm breakfast. I liked that it was a smaller hotel and staff was able to recognize my family throughout our stay. The access to Disneyland was PERFECT. We walked around a small corner and were in one of the Disney parking lots. From there we rode the Disney tram (which kids loved) to the park entrance. Overall hotel was great for my family of four and fit our budget.

The motel was easy walking access to Disneyland trams, although the staff did not clearly indicate that it was as simple as walking down the side street.  The room was clean and comfortable, with staff willing to help in every way.  Off-road parking was good.  Breakfast was adequate.  Our room was quiet on the 3rd level farthest from the main road, but obviously the main road has a lot of traffic.

Summary Heading: Great stay, close to Disneyland trams, but lousy pillows.
Summary: This hotel is in a fantastic location - about a 5min, easy, walk from the Disneyland trams. The hotel is a typical Best Western in terms of amenities. The beds were clean and comfortable, but the pillows were just terrible. They were high and hard, practically guaranteed to give you a sore neck in the morning. We just tossed them off the bed and slept flat. We didn't experience any problems with bugs, and road noise wasn't an issue as we were located in the top corner furthest away from the road. The noise from the Disneyland fireworks is significant but they only last about 10mins from 930pm. Frankly the noise generated by kids using the stairs, elevator and landing as a playground was more annoying than anything else.  Parking is tight, but free. And we didn't have any issues

When we arrived, I noticed little ants by the sink.  I didn't say anything to anyone because they weren't bothering me enough to do something.  The next morning, I was greeted by 2-inch-long cockroach next to the sink.  While I failed to catch that monster, my 6 year old daughter spotted another smaller one (still over an inch) climbing on our bed.  I zip-locked it and brought it to Juan, the manager, but failed to get an apology from him.  Instead, he asked us to repack everything and wait for the room to be clear.  He told me to wait at the lobby between noon to three that afternoon.  Hmm... I paid a lot of money to be at Disneyland, and I was not a mood to wait around at the hotel lobby.  He refused to let me move that evening after Disneyland, because he doesn't want to lose

Can't beat this for visiting Disneyland - decent hotel and so close to the tram to the main gate - five minute walk - made it so easy!! The rooms are average but clean & fairly comfy. Breakfast is what you would expect - could have been a little better but it was sufficient.

Very enjoyable and friendly, will stay here the next time we are in the Disneyland area. If you can't watch the fireworks inside the park, the pool area is the next best spot. The breakfast was ok too. They meet all our needs.

Don't know where to start on this review.  In summary, the rooms had bugs, the air conditioner could not keep up with the mild heat of spring, the breakfast was below par, the service was not helpful, no shuttle to the Disneyland park, parking was a complete joke, very noisy, and rooms were horrible.  We arrived Sunday afternoon around 3:45 to find that our room was not yet ready.  We drove through the night and the majority of the day and was looking forward to relaxing.  We had to wait an hour for our room to be ready while other people walked in and received their rooms without problems.  When asking about getting a different room that was ready or any type of compensation for making us wait, we received the reply that they were understaffed and there was nothing that can be

Tucked up right behind Disneyland on Ball Rd, this hidden gem makes  a trip to Disneyland an unexpected treat. Don't let the older exterior fool you. Above board service, simple but clean and comfortable rooms, and a complimentary breakfast with something for everybody make for a relaxing destination after a day at Disneyland. If you come home before firewords, just stand out by the pool and enjoy the excitement! The affordable price and wonderful service make this hotel a hidden gem!

Summary Heading: Price, location, and service just righ!
Summary: Arrived at 8am and were able to park car and head right to Disney!  5 to 10 min easy walk to Disney tram through Disney Staff parking lot as website promised.  Daytime desk clerk super friendly and accommodating.  On a very noisy corner, but Disney will wear you out enough to sleep.  Air and Internet worked great!  Very large flat screen tv.  The pool is super small, but you can see fireworks from there.  Breakfast was good.  I would definitely stay here again if visiting Disney.  Cheapest priced hotel of our trip, but room was about the same as others we paid twice as much for.

This was a great hotel, excellent location within walking distance to Disneyland (saved on parking cost) and good value for the money.  The service was excellent and every person we encountered was very polite and helpful.  One employee went out of her way to get us the best rate.

This motel, close to Disneyland, was perfect...not too pricy, but clean, close to the tram, with hot tub and pools to relax at the end of the day. You can even watch the fireworks from the pool!! The staff were awesome, friendly, helpful, and patient with our questions!!

I booked this hotel because I didn't want to break the bank while my family and I did Disneyland, Universal Studios and Knott's Berry Farm.  We paid less than $90/night, so I didn't expect much.  To my surprise, I was WAY wrong.  My family and I pulled into Anaheim around 8pm and I was greeted by a young lady named Genesis, who had only been on the job for three days.  As I entered the lobby, she greeted me with a smile, by name, and checked us in like a seasoned pro.  In fact, every employee we came into contact with was extremely helpful, incredible friendly and wonderful to my children.  You can definitely tell they have placed an emphasis on customer service.   We lucked out and scored a corner room, which turned out to be a little bigger then the others, so no complaints

Summary Heading: Would not cancel room, still charged us for it.
Summary: Had to cancel the morning before arrival and hotel still wanted to charge us for the room.   I cant stand hotels like this and will not be using this hotel for this policy alone.  Things come up when you travel and you need to be flexible.

My husband and I along with our two small children stayed here during a trip to Disneyland. The hotel is fairly small but the room was a great size for the four of us and they provided a crib/playard for my one year old son. The two queens beds were very comfortable, the cable tv was great and they provided plenty of towels and toiletries. The wi-fi also worked well. They offered a continental breakfast which we ate during the first morning of our stay because we wanted to head straight to the park from the hotel instead of having to stop for breakfast. It is less than a 10 minute drive to Disneyland and there are back roads to take to avoid the traffic of Harbor Boulevard. We will definitely stay here again.

Our family went to Disneyland. We got two rooms for 4 nights. Hotel in walking distance to Disneyland. Hotel OK.  Loud traffic noise. Could see fireworks from hot tub. Breakfast area very cramped with minimal choices.

This was a great option for Disneyland.  It is just north of the parking lots with a walkway to the trams. Or, just a .7 mile walk to the entrances to the park.  Not the Ritz, but still a very good option.  I will consider staying there again.

On short notice, my boyfriend & I decided to pop down for a short trip during Disneyland's off-season. Because it wasn't the busy season, we decided to try out a different Best Western (we usually stay at the Best Western Park Place Inn). This Best Western had a great location, it's just right around the corner from the parking areas. The price was great, the staff was incredibly nice & accommodating with our early check in, & the morning breakfast selection was great for grabbing coffee & a snack before heading into the parks. The room was much bigger than expected & the bed was very comfy. Didn't have any problems with the internet or any of the amenities. The only issue we could foresee with coming during a busier time of year is the small size of the parking lot. But we

Summary Heading: Great service and room, not so great internet
Summary: Our first room had a problem with the shower pressure and hot water so the staff was very helpful and understanding and gave us the room right next door (this was very gracious as we checked in late at night and it wasn't a hassle to move our stuff to another room). The service was helpful and very friendly. The rooms were clean and well in order. The internet was my only complain as a student I needed to do assignments online but was unable to do so because the WiFi just didn't connect at all. It is also by a main street so with a few ambulance sirens it was a bit noisy for a while. Other than that great quality for a low price.

I booked this hotel last minute when we realized we would likely be at Disneyland pretty late and would not want to drive at the end of the day. Despite a slightly worn down appearance on the outside and a very small lobby, we were happily surprised with the size of the room (comfortable for 5 of us)!  Staff were friendly, giving us milk late at night so I didn't have to drive to the gas station and cleaning the pool so the kids could swim.  Location is great- it is right outside DL, so you just have to walk through a parking lot and then up 1 flight of stairs to get to the Trams. Very convenient. We were able to leave DL to rest and eat dinner and then go back in for the evening shows.

This Best Western was outstanding, the staff was great, rooms are remodeled and i had  no problems with checking in early. I was hesitant staying at a Motel like facility in LA due to the scare of homeless staying in the halls. But the staff makes sure that there is someone on watch at all times to make your stay much safer.

This was a really good location for Disneyland, only 5 minutes to the tram. Great for watching fireworks at night in the hot tub. It was noisy at night though as you can hear the traffic on the street and the walls are thin. Rooms we're clean though. Basic breakfast which was okay. We struggled to find good restaurants for dinner so we ended up taking the Disney tram to downtown Disney and just ate there each night. We did have some issues though. The TV was very slow and the picture kept freezing while we tried to watch movies at night. We also asked reception to organise a taxi to pick us up in half an hour so we could go out. It turned out that he didn't call when I asked. He called when he saw us waiting for our taxi and told me 'I have called to follow them up and they said

Summary Heading: Great location! Great service! Great price! Will stay here again!
Summary: Stayed at this hotel for Disneyland's Star Wars Half Marathon Weekend. It was a 15 minute walk to the park and the staff was so friendly and accommodating. They let us borrow scissors, gave us a new remote when we wanted to hook our PS3 to the TV, and even offered us breakfast after breakfast closed and opened the pool up early for us. You can see the Disneyland fireworks show from their pool area and it is spectacular. The only thing is if you aren't outside for the fireworks, you feel like you're in a war zone. The fireworks are definitely LOUD. Regardless, I will be staying here again in the future.

Had a bad experience where the bathroom in our room had been recently painted but the job was not complete when we arrived. Still some tape up in the room, and all bath and shower fixtures had been removed, making it impossible to take a shower. Embarrassed staff tried to help by reassembling things for us, but we found when they left that the water would still not turn on (they hadn't tested it). They couldn't fix it for us that night and gave us an additional (smaller) room so we could shower, though this was inconvenient as we had to walk to another part of the hotel to do so.
