Plumber came the next day to fix it and got the water working, but still didn't test the shower - we found the shower head hadn't been installed properly and water was spraying out the back quite a bit.

This hotel is a great choice if you want easy access to Disneyland and Downtown Disney.  The staff is courteous and helpful.  The rooms are standard and you will get a good night's sleep.  You have a great view of the Disney fireworks from the pool area.  This is pretty amazing, unless you fall asleep before 9:15 pm.  They sound like they are in your back yard!  The rooms have a microwave and mini fridge, so you can bring back left overs or order into the room.  There is an ARCO station in easy walking distance for late night snacks or to get staples such as water.  The breakfast choices are decent and go from cold muffins to pre-packaged pancakes or breakfast sandwich to oatmeal and cold cereal.  Even the coffee is good!

Summary Heading: Cheap place to lay your head down
Summary: This is a basic motel, at a cheap price and that is a five minute walk to the Disney parking trams (which are then another five minute ride to the Disney entrance).  Free wifi and basic breakfast were also provided.  As long as you are not expecting much more than that, you will find this place to be fine.  Some negatives, which I didn't worry too much about given the price, were that the parking lot is too small requiring guests to double park to fit everyone in and they lacked some basic amenities.  For example, they couldn't provide us with a crib the first night and couldn't find a corkscrew to lend us.

Stayed January 2nd & 3rd.  Tip: The location of this hotel makes staying here worth it. Once you arrive there is no need for driving because Disneyland is less than a 5 minute walk away. That being said parking is limited and can be tricky if you arrive late.  This was our second stay here. The rooms are clean and the staff is great. We arrived at 11am and received an early check in with no issues. Stayed in a double on the 3rd floor. Street noise was minimal. Breakfast is packaged but filling. Warm coffee is available all day. For the price tag it can't be beat. Plus you can see the Disney firework show from the hot tub.   The only complaint we had was that ESPN was not working and on a football playoff weekend that was a bummer. Easily fixed because Downtown Disney has an ESPN

this is a great place to stay and is walking distance from Disney park price great for the location. firework show close and will wake you if sleeping. bed is a little on the to firm side. room could use a upgrade. comfortable

Continue to enjoy great service, excellent accommodations and optimistically face the ongoing challenge with parking, as it is free and always manageable though sometimes short in supply.  Small inconvenience for the convenience of location and way above average service.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay if you are going to Disneyland
Summary: I can't say enough about this hotel. They went above and beyond what they needed to do. They exceeded all of our expectations. The staff was incredible and met our every need. Rebecca, Juan and Anton were top notch and should be commended. They offered help, suggestions, and assistance in everything. The room was nice, the breakfast was great, they helped us with the parking, and offered us a smile and a kind word. They should be rewarded for their customer service. Also if you are going to Disneyland this is the perfect place to stay. You can walk to the Disney Tram in 10 minutes or less!

I was so happy with the Best Western Courtesy Inn, Anaheim!! The room was spacious, comfortable and clean. The staff was super nice and friendly. The proximity to Disneyland was awesome! Just a few steps away. The best thing was being able to relax in the pool and jacuzzi after a long day of walking with the late hour availability! I loved it!! I would definitely recommend anyone to stay here!

This is a great hotel to stay at when you visit Disneyland. It is walking distance to the free trams that take you to Disneyland, California Adventure and Downtown Disney. The hot tub was also great especially after spending all day at the parks. The hotel was clean with friendly staff.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay if you are visiting Disney
Summary: Ok, it's not the biggest hotel near to Disney and if you're looking for somewhere more than somewhere to sleep (ie: 5 stars, room service, etc...) then this isn't the place for you.  However, for us it was excellent - the place was clean and tidy. The staff were great. The only thing that lets it down slightly is that the car park gets full by early evening.  As for getting to Disney, it couldn't be easier - we stayed there for 3 nights and visited Disney all 3 days - the hotel will give you directions and a map, both to walk to and walk back from the Disney shuttles.   I would ignore their instructions on how to walk to the trams, as they send you the long way around - I would only take this route if you either can't or don't want to go up a couple of flights of stairs (around

This was a nice, clean hotel. The staff were very attentive. The best part for us was that it is a 5 minute walk to the trams that take you right to Disneyland. We felt safe in the area and we would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Unhappy with mold in the bathroom
Summary: There was a lot of mold on the bathroom ceiling.  Room had a musty old chemical smell to it. Sheets and towels had been washed a lot in bleach were rough and cheap feeling.  It is an excellent location and staff were nice.  Breakfast is adequate but rooms definitely need to be overhauled.  I think the price per night is too much for the quality of the room.

If you're going to Disneyland this is the place to stay. It's safe, has parking and is within walking distance of both Disney parks and at a reasonable price. Their beds are comfortable, its a great place to crash after a long day with the kids instead of driving home tired. I just wish they'd upgrade their breakfast then they'd be just about perfect.

We enjoy the convenience of still being within walking distance of the park though further than most adjacent properties.  Only cross one major intersection than arrive at tram/downtown Disney area.  Accommodations are reasonably priced given one or another discount and though parking is free, it is extremely limited.  Seems like you're right under the fireworks, so go out to the pool area and enjoy.

This hotel is awesome! No complaints at all! Well....one....their idea of a heated is pool is a bit chilly. Rooms are clean, staff is great, price was right! Not even a 7 minute walk to disney land...it's right out the back of the hotel! Very convenient!  Beds are very comfortable.  Shower is hot and it has water pressure! We are beyond happy that we chose this hotel to spend a week in!

walking distance to Disneyland, affordable, staff were nice, and everything worked out well during our stay. will come again, will come again, will come again, will come again, will come again, will come again, will come again, will come again, will come again, will come again, will come again, will come again...

Just returned from a 2 night stay @ the BW Courtesy Inn. The hotel offers great value for those travelling on a budget; free parking, free wi-fi, free breakfast and as close to Disney as you can get without staying at a Disney hotel.  The staff were very friendly and readily provided advice & directions.  The breakfast menu is relatively limited; heat & serve breakfast sandwiches and panckaes, as well as wide selection of packaged cereals & pastries, but there is enough variety to please most people & is very convenient before a long-day at the park.  We had no issues with the rooms; the beds were comfortable, the rooms were clean & well appointed with fridge, microwave & coffee maker.   The only potential negative is the noise from the disney fireworks at 9:25 as they are very

Our room was right on Ball Road, but we were not distracted by any real road noise. Heard a siren a couple of times.  I was a little concerned at first with the possibility of noise -- but we were not awaken at night.

We've stayed at this hotel before and we liked it that much we decided to stay here again for our 2 night stay. It's close to disneyland. The property is very well kept. The rooms are nice & clean. Very roomy & comfortable beds. Upon check in Nola greeted me right away and was very courteous, felt very welcomed! Don't hesitate to book here, great hotel. Bonus: continental breakfast :)

Summary Heading: Great value hotel close to Disney
Summary: Great value, short walk to Disney trams.  Nice, clean, comfortable room with a caring staff who wanted to make us feel comfortable.  Breakfast was just OK but the young woman caring for it made sure everything was available and fresh and that we had everything we needed.

Summary Heading: Another Fabulous stay at BWCI Anaheim!
Summary: This was our second visit in less than a year - this trip we stayed 8 nights for some Disneyland magic. All of the elements that made us fall in love with this hotel in March were still there - great service, clean and cozy room, fabulous pool & spa plus an unbeatable hearty breakfast each morning. We absolutely love this hotel and consider it our go to spot when we stay outside the parks. Thank you again to the staff of the best Western Courtesy Inn Anaheim for another wonderful stay - we'll see you again soon!

We ended up staying here because our original hotel choice ended up being full before we booked our stay and I am so glad we found this hotel!  The rooms were nice size and we were able to put a blow up twin bed on the floor (because our kids won't sleep together) and there was still ample room to move around.  The breakfast was great and exceeded the usual danishes and cereal options.  The walk to catch the Disneyland Tram was minimal, at most a 8 minute walk. Parking is tight but we never had to go anywhere so it was fine for us.

This motel is a close walk to Disneyland, in fact we watched the fireworks from the hot tub.  The room was comfortable with a nice breakfast.  The staff was very helpful.  I highly recommend this motel if you are coming to Disneyland and want to conserve your expenses.

Summary Heading: Great location, great rooms, did double charge us though
Summary: great location, great room service, good comfy rooms, would have given 4 stars but the check in guy has double charged us for a pre paid stay and unfortunately with such trips, it is hard to follow up on charges once you leave a country !

The service was excellent and the walk to Disneyland was around 10 minutes. The only thing I disliked about the hotel was the parking area because it's way too small, but other than that I would recommend this hotel for anyone on a budget!

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel with a great friendly staff
Summary: We stayed here in September and had a great time. The location is good. About a 15 minute walk to the park. You cut through the staff parking.  This is a small hotel. About 38 rooms. They keep it very clean and the staff was super helpful while there.  Rooms are nice and clean and have everything you need. After all you don't spend much time here. You're in the parks.  Pool and Hot tub was nice. And open until 11:00pm. The staff let us stay late as we were quiet. Was very nice of them.

Rooms were cleaned daily, linens changed daily, desk staff and housekeeping were very accomodating and friendly.  Triple room was very spacious.  Carpets appear new.  There was no overwhelming cover-up deodorizers that usually signal mustiness or smoke. Within walking distance to Disney - no need to arrange special transportation! Breakfast was adequate, had a good selection of foods, and was well stocked.  Overall, it is a good value for the location and was a pleasant experience for our extended family get-together.

Considering the cost of the Disney Hotels per night and the actual amount of time you really spend in the room this hotel was a great value. It is practically on the Disney grounds and very easy to get to the park and hotels.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay if you are going to Disneyland
Summary: The hotel is average 2.5-3 stars out of 5 but the convenience of walking to the Dland parking garage and catching the tram into the park makes staying here worth it (oh yeah, and saving $20 for not having to pay to park at Dland).

Summary Heading: Family Friendly, Five minute walk to Disneyland Tram
Summary: Very nice hotel, decent continental breakfast for a small hotel. Clean rooms, comfortable beds, and very friendly staff.  The hotel has a pool and a hot tub that is open until 11pm.  The walk to the Disney Trams was about five minutes for us but it can be shorter. The walk is through the Disney's employee parking lot. Don't waste your money on the ART unless you really, really have to.  Before reserving a room on this hotel I was hesitant because I was not sure about the distance from the hotel to the Trams but once I was there, I was very glad that it was very close.  We didn't have to use ART at all.  There's a gas station/convenience store across the street in case you want to get snacks.  We stayed there for five nights.  Originally we reserved the room for four nights but

I have just completed a 3 night stay at BW Courtesy Inn, Anaheim. Wonderful stay overall. Location is great; within a short walking distance to tram that takes you to the entrance to down town Disney and from there a short walk to entrances. The employees, all, were very helpful. Dan, at the front desk went above and beyond and his smile is contagious! Next time I am in the area I will not hesitate to stay here again!

I arrived with my son around 10 pm...without a reservation. The receptionist was very nice, he greeted us with a nice smile, and made our reservation, helped us enroll on your program and gave us a welcome goody bag. The room was very clean and over all comfortable...nice wi fi service, and the big cherry on top was the continental breakfast...it is the best I have had in all the motels I have stayed in my travel...I will be coming back, next time with a little light out, to enjoy the nice pool!!

We stayed as a family of 9 in 2 adjoining rooms. This place is withing a short walk to Disneyland/Downtown Disney. We spent time together talked, watched TV, movies, hung out at the pool, watched the fireworks from Disneyland. Great Stay!

The room smelt really bad. The fireworks were really loud and we weren't given any warning how loud it would be. We had a really terrible showering experience. The water was freezing cold and had barely any pressure. The instructions on the faucet were completely wrong. When you turned toward the hot water, the water just trickled out of the faucet. And when we went to complain or get help (at 4am) there was no one in the office. The parking was also very limited. We don't plan to stay at this hotel ever again.

Summary Heading: Good Value and Easy access to Disneyland
Summary: The place is deceiving from the outside. It appears small but the room was good sized. The room was comfortable and the breakfast was good. The best part was how close to  Disneyland it is. It is a comfortable walking distance there and even shorter coming back after a long day of walking. Nice perk being able to leave the car on property to save on parking fee. Very helpful staff. Definitely would do again!

I found the price of this hotel very reasonable, especially for a Disneyland area hotel. The hotel room was acceptable. I was not staying there to enjoy the luxuries of Best Western, but to have a convenient room near to the theme parks. A big plus is that this hotel has a pool AND limited breakfast items. The breakfast items are small prepackaged muffins, oatmeal, fruit (bananas and oranges), yogurt, microwavable breakfast sandwiches, etc...but it was one less thing I had to worry about during the trip. I read one review which stated that the hot water did not work. I found that the shower faucet was mismarked, and that turning the faucet toward cold gave hot water (just a tip...). My only qualm was that the AC unit in the room was not powerful, at all. I felt that the room was

Best Western Courtesy Inn, Anaheim Ca. was a great for the money. The facility was clean and the room large enough to accommodate two adult and two teenagers. The best part was a walking distance from Disney Park , which made it convenient for us.

I stayed at the Hotel expecting Best Western accommodations that I have received at other Best Westerns, the Hotel has very little parking and the room are gross, there was brownish red spots splattered across the ceiling, the showers would not drain and the water barely got hot. The overall cleanliness of the hotel was just unsatisfactory. I would recommend other hotels in the area as they were similar in pricing.

Summary Heading: family of 6 great experience for $ will be our new choice for hotel for future travels
Summary: my family of 6 including myself had a great stay at your hotel. we were all impressed with the accommodations. We had 3 comfortable queen beds, room spacious.Iron board/ iron. TV/cable everything worked well. Breakfast was individually wrapped many healthy options. Parking was smooth.The experience was first rate for the price. Friendly sincere staff. Will be our new choice for hotel for our future travels. Thank you

It's an okay hotel near Disney.  It's an older building so expect to hear the noises through the walls.  But overall has been updated on the inside.  It does have free wifi , mini fridge, microwave. Will probably not stay here again but it was close and reasonably priced.

This hotel close is suit to the ones who wants to stay in clean and cheap hotel in the heart of Anaheim close to Disney. You can walk for ten minutes and take the train (Odong-odong) you reach the destination. Okay? try.

This hotel is very close to Disneyland, so be ready to hear the fireworks as if they were going off in the hotel lobby.  Fair breakfast setup- basics with juice and coffee, and microwavable items..  Our room was a little run down, but ok for the price. The hotel staff was nice, and switched our room when we found out the TV wasn't working right.

Felt safe, comfortable, clean, has in room refrigerator, AC unit, coffee maker, nice little continental breakfast and free parking(which is huge). It was in easy walking distance to Disneyland and overall was a great value!  The front desk was very nice, helpful and knowledgeable.  They had a small pool and hot tub but we did not go in it since we were so busy bit it looked clean and stocked with towels.

We stayed at Best Western Comfort Inn while visiting Disney at end of April and first week May 2014. I had booked this Hotel from reviews from TA and found the hotel was as described by others that had stayed here.  Our stay was for 8 days before flying back to NZ. We stayed on the 3rd floor in the corner room 306. I would recommend trying to get a corner room as those rooms close to Ball Road may be a bit affected by the traffic noise. At the back noise was not an issue. The room was nice and roomy. Two big comfortable beds, air con, flat screen tv, fridge and microwave and writing desk. There is an elevator and good stairs at either end of the buildings . Smoking areas on level two.  The pool was more than adequate with a hot tub too. Our 12 year old enjoyed the pool and we

The location is great, right by the Disneyland and near a mall where you can dine. Our hotel room is very clean, good internet speed too. It didn't bother me but my husband felt annoyed that the bathroom sink is located outside of the bathroom but it was more like a part of the bedroom.

Nice to be within potential walking distance of parks or trams and Downtown Disney.  Noise from nightly fireworks quite loud unless you go out by the pool to watch.  Property undergoing search for new manager.  Pointed out several opportunities to pursue:  Need to reduce exterior/street noise in rooms; need to fix reception (pertaining to sound) for several channels (including some HBO channels); need to clean and then keep covered, ADA poolside chair lift device; need to fix ever so slightly running commode, need to be forthright when claiming that everything is working when there were clearing somethings known not to be working.

Complimentary continental breakfast, free parking, free internet, fridge and microwave are all great to have, and if you are only sleeping there since most of your time is in Disneyland, then this hotel is OK. But the rooms open to the outside instead of a secure hallway, so you experience the road noise, cig smoke, and don't feel really safe. The room itself seemed recently renovated, but is was not very clean.

Clean! Close to Disneyland! Comfortable Beds! Microwave and refrigerator in room. Air Conditioning unit is old school, but works well! Can hear sounds outside window and around. Staff was extremely welcoming and helpful! Breakfast is juice, milk, coffee, toast, cereal, egg mcmuffins, mini-pancakes, and muffins.

Rooms are nice, and clean: the beds were welcoming and comfortable. Thankful for the continental breakfast to start our morning out before strolling up to catch the tram into Disneyland. The walk back from the tram was quicker being able to walk through the parking structure and out the employee parking lot straight to the hotel. Small, cozy and friendly, great if you are on a budget and a great value. Would definitely stay here again.

Very nice hotel considering the price... the walk to Disneyland was the only bad experience I had. Wish they had a shuttle. Staff was very friendly! Parking was a tight squeeze but staff will help you find parking if none are available in parking lot. Breakfast was descent, nothing special. My Hotel stay overall was Great!

Great location. Very close to Disneyland park. Close to airport and shopping. Excellent rooms. Great hotel at very good price. Over all excellent service. Free breakfast and car parking. All amenities are very close.

The hotel was rather run down, the staff  didn't make you feel like they would go above and beyond to meet your needs. The breakfast was just packaged foods that tasted very chemically, not good. The pics of the hotel make it look like there is lots of room to eat together in the morning but the lobby and sitting area is so small it made you feel like you were intruding on others as there were only 3 very small tables. We ended up carrying our food back to our rooms and eating sitting on our beds. The walk is a little further than expected to get to the tram and to get back, certainly not a quick 5 minutes more like a good 12-15 minutes.

Disneyland trip with my 16 yr old. Motel was clean, room was clean, front office staff is helpful in booking shuttles and day trips. Location is close enough to DL to walk. Pool is very small and is in parking lot. The area lacks dining choices as you have to walk to Downtown Disney(15 min) for up to Harbour street (a good 20 minutes) The place worked for us as we did not need a pool, or have small children that wanted to be immersed in all that is Disney! Bring earplugs to sleep Noisy on very busy interesection.

The only complaint is that the walk to Disney is a little long. It states that it is across the street from Disneyland which is true, however, the walk is easily approx. 1 mile. The rooms/staff/breakfast were all awesome. Would stay here again.

We had room 312 on the 3rd floor - with a pretty view of the pool and spa. Our room was clean and cozy with very comfortable beds. After a seamless and easy breezy check-in, my first impression was that the room was nice, very inviting - I noticed little touches like the orchid on the vanity counter. Fridge, microwave, coffee maker and hairdryer were a great convenience.  Bathroom had great shower pressure and was always fully stocked with Paya Organics bath and face products. The complimentary breakfast selection was huge - 2 types of hot breakfast sandwiches, pancakes, muffins, danish, oatmeal, cold cereals, toast with jams and peanut butter, fresh fruit, yogurt, juices, teas and great coffee with French vanilla creamer.  The staff is warm, friendly and very accommodating -

I stayed at the BWCI 3/15-17 2014.  This was first time here, so I was skeptical, as most  first timers are.  I arrived at the hotel at 10 am, too early for check in  and I was going over into Disneyland for the day.  I decided to go in and ask if I could park my car early and then do a late check in.  They were very accommodating and let me park and then provided walking directions to the park, which is a 15 min walk.  The rooms are very clean, fully stocked with fridge, micro, hair dryer, they even were generous putting extra shampoo/conditioners out on the vanity.  The beds were fine, we slept with no issues there.  The staff was friendly, super helpful too.  The breakfast is typical continental... Microwaveable sausage sandwiches, pancakes, fruit, cereal, yogurt, juice and

We stayed at the BW Courtesy Inn for the last week of February 2014. The hotel is located within walking distance from Disneyland and California Adventure parks, taking about 25-35 minutes depending on your pace.  Hint: To return to the hotel it is quicker to take the tram from outside Disneyland gates to the parking structure, take the escalator to level 2, walk along the right (east) side of the structure and exit down the stairway on the north side to the employee lot. From there it is a short walk straight across the lot to the hotel. Security at the lot may or may not let you enter the lot from the hotel side but exiting works fine. The hotel is located on Ball Rd which is a busy street.  About a mile to the east is a hospital which probably accounted for higher than

Just arrived at hotel not too long ago. We came from out of town and had a late arrival! Check in was a breeze and the girl was very nice! The room was very nice & really clean! Really nice presentation! I would stay here again! Don't let reviews fool you it's a great hotel! Everything you need in the room: microwave,fridge,coffee maker, iron w/ironing board! Thank you best western!

Stayed at Best Western Courtesy Inn, Anaheim, Ca. Rooms are clean and well kept. Great water pressure in tub/shower. Quiet even though the property sits on a main street. Felt safe and comfortable. Wish the beds were softer. Breakfast is awful.

Our stay here was good. Super close to Disneyland and comfortable beds. Good breakfast with portions to go which is convenient. Only bad part was wifi in the room was terrible. It was nice to have a refrigerator to store our food and beverages overnight. The room was good and cable TV was fine too.

We spent 5 days at the Best Western Courtesy Inn in Anaheim, California. This little hotel turned out to be a pearl. The rooms were spacious, clean and comfy and very quiet. The free continental breakfast was good enough to take the edge off so you could get to the park and do a character breakfast with your kids or munch on beignets and coffee. One bonus was being able to see the fireworks from the pool or hot tub. We will definitely be staying here again

the hotel was comfortable and it was clean. We walked to Disneyland park which was within decent walking distance. I my self being a breakfast lover love the free continental breakfast but this one was a little dissatisfying. They had pancakes that came in a package and were soggy. They had yogurt which was good and apples and oranges. No toast and no bagels and the orange juice carton was small

My daughter was in a car accident and I had to cancel my reservation and fly home that day.  I explained this to the front desk and they said they didn't care they were still charging me a day hotel stay.  We were going to stay only two days and it was during the week.  The hotel was not full.  I didn't understand how cold and mean people can be until this.  I will never stay at this place and probably never at a Best Western again.  My advise "dont' have an emergency" you will get no consideration from these people.

The walk was good for a family with no small children though it would not be recommended for those with health problems or lots of gear to haul (like strollers and diaper bags). The traffic noise was comparable to other area hotels that right off of major roads like Harbor and Ball (with this hotel off of Ball). The beds were clean and very comfortable, the room smelled good, and the TV worked great. The bathroom was super clean with no visible damage to the tile or facilities (like we've seen in other low-priced places). Lobby is small with friendly staff. The hot tub and pool were warm, awesome and clean too!

This is a very clean Best Western in a good location if you're visiting Disneyland, Angel Stadium or Honda Center, or any other attraction in Anaheim.  Its right off I-5, and there are plenty of shops and restaurants in the area.  Great continental breakfast, exceptional service by staff.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay while visiting Disneyland!
Summary: This was the perfect place to stay while visiting Disneyland.  We will definitely stay here again.  The room was very clean and large with a refrigerator and microwave.  It was about a 15 minute walk to Downtown Disney, but there was a bus stop right outside the door for those who would prefer to ride, and I am pretty sure the all-day bus pass was only $4.  The hotel has a nice little breakfast..no waffles but lots of choices including microwavable pancakes.  The staff was very nice.  Great value and we'll be back!

The hotel is walking distance to Disneyland. It is a good value for your vacation dollar. It's not fancy, but it's clean and the people are friendly. The breakfast is pretty good too (only cold foods).

We choose this hotel online due to its price and location to Disneyland. We stayed Friday and Saturday night. This hotel is in dire need of a remodel from the bottom up and the parking lot is very small. The room that we stayed in, #110, had a very pungent odor to the point where  the air felt thick. There were stains on the carpet and the dividing strip between the carpet and the bathroom had sharp nails coming through. Ouch! Also the cheap and unstable toilet seat needs to be replaced. Whenever we showered, it elevated the temperature in the whole room. So we had to turn on the air conditioner to dehumidify and cool down the room. Another factor was the noise, the rooms are not noise insulated. We came back to the hotel during the afternoon for a nap. We found that both

trip was for family to see disney all lit up for the holidays and celebrate my wife's bday, the hotel was perfect location easy access to and from disney, however only issue was with the Tv, has the remote stopped working and when they gave us a new one and tried changing batteries still didn't work, also quite a few channels just did not work or was so distorted you couldn't watch the programming just listened to it, other then this our stay met expectations.

Summary Heading: The best Best Western in Anaheim
Summary: We are pass holders who stay every month in Anaheim, we stay at Best Westerns. Of the 4 we have stayed at in disney area ,this is our preference. Compared to the one by the gate the rooms are larger and much better value. Compared to stovells the beds are much more comfortable.Compared to other Best Westerns in the area this one is easier to return to at the end of a tiring day.  The way to come back to the motel is to take the Disney parking structure tram. You will need to go up to the daisy level and take stairs to the back lot( this where the employees park, so just follow one ) . The motel is located directly behind the emploee lot.  Please note that motels and hotels in this area tend to be just a place to sleep in at night. If you are looking for a resort place you will

It's advertised as close to Disney.  It's really not close to an entrance.  If you are walking there and interested in an entrance to the park, you are over a mile away.  It's overpriced as it's just an average hotel.  Hotels closer to the park are better and cheaper.  This hotel has that smell of indian food that stinks.  The breakfast is in an area about as small as a bathroom.  It's not a terrible place, but not worth it.

I first looked at reviews and photos of the Best Western Courtesy inn and many people were satisfied. For one, i was NOT. The location and the way the hotel look is not pleasing at all. The rug in the room felt old. And the people at the front desk were neither welcoming or rude. Just not the kind of experience I want to have on a "magical" vacation to Disney.

The hotel is pretty near from Disneyland. I recomend to stay here. We walked every morning and it was like 15 min. to the Disneyland shuttle. The breakfast was a little bit tiny but good enough. Very good for the price I pay.

I had read the TripAdvisor comments, and everyone seemed to say the same --- that this hotel/motel was clean and  everyone was so nice.  I completely agree with those comments after staying 3 nights there.  After spending longs days at Disneyland, it was nice to have a comfortable clean place to totally relax.  Disneyland is about a 15 minute walk to the front gate going in the morning, but in the evening you can ride the Disneyland tram to the parking lot, go to the second floor, and walk through the employees parking lot back to the hotel.  This is about a 10 minute walk, so is shorter than in the morning.  Parking is free at this hotel.  Parking is $16 at Disneyland, so you are definitely saving money by staying here.  I recommend this hotel.

Upon check in I presented credit card.  Was told my credit card declined.  Presented another credit card that was approved.  When I got to the room I checked on my credit card.  The card was not declined, it was charged.  Both cards were charged.  The hotel said there was nothing they can do.  I have to dispute the charge with my credit card company, and wait 5 days to be refunded.   This seriously effected my Disneyland budget. Was told by the hotel staff that this happens all the time.

Booked this hotel after receiving a Best Western email advertising great rates if you book online. We booked for 3 nights online. Prior to flying into LA, I printed off my email confirmation for the three nights so I had my confirmation number handy. Checked in at 1am and was told that Best Western does not charge your credit card until after you check in. She saw that I had a reservation but proceeded to do her "computer" check in and then told me I needed to sign the credit card receipt just printed from her computer and THEY CHARGED ME $150 MORE than what I had booked online. I told her I was not going to sign the receipt as my online booking said $252 and she was charging me $400! Thankfully she told me to go and have a good nights sleep and the manager would be there in the

great clean hotel. but no parking (thats why it's free) all the emp park in front of the rooms. people park SUV in compact spaces. customers dbl parked blocking us in at times.. but a clean hotel.  close to disneyland and califirina adventures. very easy to get in and out of if you get back early enough to get a spot. beds were very good.. but again the issue was parking.

This hotel is walking distance to the Disneyland parks, you can actually see the fireworks from your window and the pool/hot tub area (which I'll talk about in just a second). The beds are so comfortable!!! The shower is also amazing and it helps a lot when trying to relax, but the best part for it is definitely the hot tub/pool area, just go there and enjoy the miracles of what changing between hot and cold water will do to your tired body from walking around Disney. Wonders, I tell ya!!! Every guest I talked to in this hotel was also very nice and was enjoying their experience as well. The front desk was very helpful when I needed a universal charger and could not find one. Best hotel experience I've had in the USA so far!

Stayed at hotel for one night prior to Disneyland vacation.  We stayed in a 3 queen bed room.  The room was huge.  Plenty of room for our party of 5 adults.  Room had a microwave and refrigerator.  Room was on 2nd floor and outside the room there were benches you could sit on to enjoy the evening.  Excellent breakfast was offered with siting areas inside, outside as well as the option to take food back to your room.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel within walking distance of Disneyland
Summary: Got to the hotel late and there was not much parking left.  Lot is very small and cars park very close together.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  Room was pretty clean.  Large stain on carpet and some hair in bathroom were the only real complaints.  Nice to have free Wi-Fi. Easy 15 min walk to Disneyland.  Maybe, 30 min from the beach.

Very good facility, had a corner double room with a view of Ball Rd and the pool was right across the parking lot.  First things first, the AC worked great....The internet was fast and free,  big comfortable beds and the bathroom was stocked with nice towels and supplies. The manger and staff were helpful and friendly and the morning breakfast had a good variety of food items and beverages. The price was also a pleasant surprise for a one night stay on a FRI !  Only thing to deal with here is the constant pedestrian traffic of the Disneyland employees that walk to work from the nearby parking lot around 5pm ..other than that, I'd stay here again anytime.   Good stay and good value

Stayed here to go to Disney and it was awesome for the price. really close to the park that didn't need to drive. The staff was very helpful. That's all I wanted to say but I need to write 200 characters minimum.

This is very nice hotel to stay. Staff are nice and helpful. very close to the Disneyland. Price is good. Microwave and coffee maker in the room which are very handy. Room are nice and clean. Parking spot for every guest. internet is free. Overall worth of your money. Just the renovation is not very stylish, kind of out of date.

Great people here and a great location. Never have to worry about the beds or cleanliness.  Just had 4th stayhere and we'll come again before the year is  through.  it's right at Ball near the Disney emplyee parking area.  This makes leaving the park a breeze.  We used to enter there but, due to some negligence on the part of a guest you can't do that anymore.  Occasionally you can make your way in this way but, you have to befriend an emplyoyee but, cast members will NEVER do that ;o)

Summary Heading: Right Next Door to Disneyland, great value, great room
Summary: My husband is handicapped. They had great rooms with shower chairs and rails.  We were on ground floor near a nice patio to sit.  The pool was nice. The staff could not have been more helpful.  The continental breakfast was nice and had some protein with it also.  I have hypoglycemia and cannot take advantage of many breakfasts offered.  Great value for a room right next door to Disneyland.  We watched the fireworks from right outside our hotel nightly.

Did a great job all the way through at the Best Western Courtesy Inn. Parking is tight and the coffee was awful, but the was pleased with the everything else and would stay there again. Like the location a lot. The front desk staff was helpful.

Summary Heading: The place stinks and very nosiy
Summary: This was suppose to be a nonsmoking room, but it ended up to be the opposite.   It seemed they tried to get rid of the smoke odor by adding another stinking smell to it which made it even worse. On top of this, the noise level was just way up there.  It felt like we were sleeping on the side-walk.

The elevator was filthy, the carpet in our room was disgusting (we all kept our shoes on the whole time we were there), the furniture is in bad need of an upgrade, the "free parking" is a joke - there were no spaces available - we had to double park and have our room called in the morning so we could move our car so the other guest could get their car out.  The air conditioner was extremely LOUD to run.  The walls are paper thin and we heard a couple having a sexual experience on one side of us and a very loud family on the other. The extremely harsh florescent light in the overhead light by the window is UGLY!  The internet was EXTREMELY slow.  The TV remote / cable service provided was very NOT user-friendly and the TV had difficulty responding to the remote.

Great place to stay when in Anaheim, close to Disneyland and other places of interest. Staff was extremely helpful and courteous,  pool and hot tub was terrific after a long day at Disney, will stay at this hotel next trip!

When traveling with our five children we often have to get two hotel rooms -- which can really get expensive. This Best Western (1070 W. Ball, Anaheim CA) has a very large "family room" with three queen beds -- which was perfect for us and allowed us to all stay in one room. The cost for the family room was only $20 more than the standard room, so we also saved $$. The breakfast was fine -- nothing fancy, but a decent variety of options. The pool is heated and clean. Overall we have a very positive experience and will choose this hotel again.

Only stayed one night.  Motel is a little run down, could use some refurbishing.  Not enough parking, it's double stacked.  Room was clean enough but had a strange smell. Continental Breakfast was good.  Overall stay, was Average!

Summary Heading: Excellent choice for proximity to Disneyland
Summary: Friendly staff, rooms are typical,carpets were not very clean, no workout facility, but pool and hotub were nice and well maintained . If you are going to Disneyland this hotel is right around the corner and has easy access to Disney at the fraction of the cost of on site hotels....it is located on a corner and there is a lot of traffic noise so bring earplugs!!! I would recommend it

I have stayed here before and was impressed with the manager and his staff. Everyone was helpful and friendly. The rooms are clean and everything was in good condition. Housekeeping added little touches that made the room even nicer. It is very close to Disneyland and Downtown Disney. Whenever I visit Disneyland I plan to stay here. It was a very good value for the money.

I am a loyal Best Western traveler and have stayed at the other hotels in the Anaheim area, but find this one to be the best value and at a great location. This is my second time staying here while visiting Disneyland.  My husband and I stayed 4 nights to use a 3-day park-hopper ticket. It is very easy to walk to the park in the morning and leave through the employee parking lot.  The employee gate is not always available for entrance depending on who is at the gate, but we did get in one evening to go to Downtown Disney during our stay.  The rooms have been upgraded since my last visit and the bedding is a solid brown, much nicer than the floral bedspreads.  I have a very nice mattress at home and was able to sleep very well on the Queen bed, as did my husband.  Our room was

Just a run down hotel and walls were so thin. Would never stay here again. A/C didn't work well. Just bad. Rooms need to be updated! TV is from the 80's.  Bathrooms need to be updated and they need to re caulk the entire bathroom.  Bed felt so hard and uncomfortable.

Summary Heading: Never stay here again, you get what you pay for
Summary: Previous to me booking a hotel for our Disneyland trip, I actually read good reviews of this place, so I went for it. Location-if you don't mind walking about 12-15 minutes up an uphill bridge to the Disneyland tram, then go for it. When I first arrived, about 10:30 am they didnt have any rooms available for me to check-in, which was what I kind of expected anyways. I was lucky enough to find the last available parking spot on the lot. Parking lot was very small. I was able to leave my car parked there while we went to Disneyland for the day. Free parking was a plus. We came back to hotel at around 4pm to check in our room, having to once again do the 15 minute walk back to hotel and 15 minute walk back to Disneyland. At 11 o'clock at night, it wasn't very fun walking back to

Great place if walking a short distance into disney grounds or drive just to blocks into Disneys parking lot,also like the front desk service and choices of their continantal breakfast.easy accses to freeway.

Summary Heading: It was just okay for us
Summary: We planned on spending 3 consecutive days at Disney so we selected this hotel because the two other Best Western brands were booked solid for the days we would be there.  It was my wife and son who was 3 years old at the time.  When you just finish a long drive with a 3 year old you just want to get out of the car and relax.    Upon arriving and checking in, several guest were arguing with the desk clerk which threw up a red flag right away.   The hotel clerk was a young lady and seemed pretty new so I could tell she was flustered and doing the best she could.  Someone finally came to help her and the aggravated guest and they were taken care of but I had to wait about 15 minutes which annoyed me.  The other problem is they don't seem to have enough parking to accommodate all of

This small motel has a reasonable cost and offers a free excellent breakfast.  A major advantage is that it is within walking distance to Disneyland.  About a 600 yards walk through the employees' parking lot takes one to the tram that operates between the parking structure and Disneyland.  There is very little wait to board the tram shuttle.

We stayed here on a Saturday and Sunday night. It is very close to Disneyland and we arrived when the fireworks were going off at the park which made it quite the spectacular arrival indeed. The room was clean with a refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, ample closet space, nice linens, etc. We slept pretty well, enjoyed the jacuzzi both nights and did try the free breakfast in the morning, which consisted of prepackaged, microwave ready items like pancakes, egg, cheese & pork product biscuits. There were packets of oatmeal, cereal, and some white bread for toast also. For us this was a disappointment to find no real fresh items but for families & couples heading to the attractions it might be a plus. The TV in the room could use some updating, but the Wi-fi was fast and

We really enjoyed our stay and the proximity to the Disneyland tram! It was only a 10 minute walk from the hotel to the tram. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and the breakfast was great! Thanks :)

We stayed here three nights on our recent trip to Disneyland and Disney California Adventure. The rooms were clean and nicely appointed; the hotel quiet and conveniently located. It's a small hotel, which we prefer (fewer people to jostle with). They have a good free breakfast (microwaveable breakfast sandwiches and pancakes, cereal, fruit, muffins, juices, coffee, tea, etc.). The staff was very helpful and accommodating. I developed a foot blister from all the walking and they gave me some adhesive bandages to make things more comfortable. The hotel is, seriously, only a five minute walk to the trams that take you to the Disney properties.  We would definitely stay here again, and recommend it to others.

Summary Heading: Clean and convenient, with helpful manager and staff
Summary: I made a three night reservation at this Best Western through Orbitz, for a Disneyland trip with my granddaughter. This is a small property, only 37 units, with an even smaller parking lot (the manager says 34 but that’s with “valet” or double parking – but there is room nearby if needed). The parking is free (one car per room), unlike at many nearby hotels.   One of the things I liked most about the property was the location. I had never stayed on this side of Disneyland  before. But it was a 10 minute walk from the property on Ball through an employee parking lot (open to non-employee pedestrians coming in the morning) to the Mickey and Friends parking lot, where you’d park if you drove. From there you can take the parking lot shuttle (which runs continuously) to the main

Summary Heading: Fine If Resting Up for a Return to Disneyland is What You're Looking For
Summary: Located on busy Ball Rd., wedged into a small piece of real estate, this 3 story motel serves its purpose - if that purpose is that you are looking for a spot that has decent rooms, a quick microwaveable breakfast, and is 2 minutes (by car)/25 (on foot) to Disneyland.  Parking at the motel is tight - 1 car/reserved room.  Employees were polite.  Room was adequate.  Nothing fancy at all, but no major complaints (just a minor musty smell coming from AC, which lessened after a while).   Free WiFi (a bit weak on 3rd floor).  If my wife and I were looking for a get away spot, this is not the place.  If, like my daughter, you wish to spend all day at Disneyland, have a decent, fairly inexpensive place to recharge your batteries, then head back to the Magic Kingdom the next morning,

The room is very spacious with two large beds. The room is also clean and has a fridge and coffee maker. The hotel is direct on ball road so most rooms get a good share of traffic noise. I had to turn on the air condition to make background noise to get over this problem. Although the pillows and sheets are clean, the pillows had some smell in them (a weird type of detergent maybe? I am overly sensitive to smells anyway and a normal person may not feel it).   There is a good sized bath room and shower.  The breakfast is not great but it contains most of the items in a continental breakfast but the breakfast area is very small (two tables!!!). I found out later that they have trays that you can pack your breakfast on and take it to the outside lounge area or even to your room.

Summary Heading: Ringing in the New Year at Disney!!!
Summary: I booked this hotel based on the previous reviews.  The hotel was clean and very accommodating.  The kids loved the breakfast and coffee and hot water were available round the clock.  We needed it when we returned from the park. It is a short walk to the parking garage where you pick up the tram to get into the park.

Close to Disneyland with  free parking, breakfast & Wifi. Coffee and hot water in lobby all the time with vanilla creamer.  Very nice managers and staff. Can watch fireworks from pool area. ask and it is taken care of timely. We stay here every month.

We stayed here on our recent trip to Disneyland, the location is ok if you don't have kids, which we don't so we would walk to the parks about a 15min walk. I understand you can cut through the cast member parking lot next door and take the tram from the parking garage, but we chose to walk. The rooms, were very clean, and spacious, everything worked well. The parking lot is pretty small, but so is the hotel with about 36 rooms total. The continental Breakfast was awesome!!!! We would totally stay here again.

the hotel is in walking distance to the Disneyland theme parks, but on a very busy road.  breakfast is ok for American standards but nothing exceptional.  Internet connectivity is lousy, low bandwidth and not on all platforms I could log in.  rooms are spacious and clean.  personnel is very friendly and helpful

My family stays here every time we go to Disneyland. It is just literally around the corner from the parking structure and within walking distance also. The bonus is that it has a fantastic staff, a great continental breakfast and clean, comfortable rooms.

Summary Heading: bad service and smell really bad
Summary: room smell really bad need to wash the carpet elevetor was not working had to go up by stairs 3 floors night person was asleep were ringing the bell and no one show up till 20min later very small area for breakfast

we had a great view of fireworks from Disneyland sitting out in the pool. only problem was not enough parking at motel. Motel situated near dining, gas, parks, and was still very quiet at night. Slept very well, breakfast good, excellent variety of foods.

Spent a long weekend here for a Disneyland getaway. The furniture may be a little dated but comfortable. The property and room were very clean and you can tell the property has been well maintained. The beds were more firm than I prefer but still I slept well. The breakfast okay, very basic but there were more items than I expected. The fruit was always fresh and tasty. If you looking for a full breakfast then you will need to go to a local restaurant. The items offered at the hotel are a good get the day started option.  The staff were very helpful and friendly and I felt went out of there way to make us feel comfortable and welcome. We arrived early on Friday morning and they stored our luggage for us while we visited Disneyland and checked in later in the day. The manager

My family and I stayed here for 7 days and it was perfect for us.  I was a little nervous after reading some of the reviews but had a great experience!   Check in/out was easy and fast and the front desk staff were friendly and helpful with suggestions, directions etc.  We were in a room on the 2nd floor which was clean and updated (aside fromt he nightstand and dresser but who cares!); the beds were comfy and the cleaning staff did a great job each day and accomodated a few special requests that we made.  It was nice to have a fridge and microwave in the room as well.   The continental breakfast was fine and you are able to fill up a tray and take it back to your room if the tables are full in the breakfast space.  Some of the other reviews complained about the variety, I'm not

First off, anyone who complains about this location is crazy.  Or  hasn't stayed in a while.  The proximity to Disneyland makes it absolutely great for families planning to see the park.  There's a nice little pool and hot tub to rest your weary feet at the end of the day, and the rooms were always cleaned and tidy.  For the amount of time you will actually be in your room they are perfect.  The staff here was incredible.  The whole time we were here, (7 days), we only saw two staff members working the front desk.  Both staff members were absolutely incredible!  They did everything they could to make an already great stay even better.   The cleaning staff was also very good at their job, any requests we made were taken care of promptly and correctly.  The ONLY caveat that I have

My only concern from other reviews was about the lack of parking for this motel, but we arrived before 9 p.m. and were able to find a parking space.  Since we were within easy walking distance to the Disneyland shuttle, we never had to move the car until we checked out.    We loved the size of our room!  Had a great view of the Disneyland fireworks from our room.  The Disney shuttle from the Mickey & Friends parking garage was only 5 minutes walking time from our room, so the location was very convenient.  It was nice to hop on the shuttle and get back to our room within just a few minutes so we could take a break in our day.  It was great to have a refrigerator and microwave to be able to prepare our own food and cut the cost of our trip.  They also have a continental

Stayed here the last week in September 2012 because it was close to Disneyland.  Nice, clean room.  Comfortable but firm bed.  Good pillows.  Front desk employees were very nice and helpful; quick check in/out.  Pool/spa is clean - there's a "closing" time for the pool, but the clerk said as long as we were quiet, we could stay there as long as we wanted.  Just one thing about the shower, especially if you have young children, as with a lot of motels when you're in the shower and another room turns on the shower, the water can turn really hot, so just be careful.  We didn't take a tram to Disneyland; we just walked.  It's pretty much a straight shot and takes about 15 minutes.  We had our four year old grandson with us, and he had no problem walking that distance.  Continental

Went to Disneyland a few months ago with my best friend and we chose to stay here for three nights - we paid $275 total. The employees were nice and helpful. The pool was nice and clean, we didn't swim in it though - we were too busy being at Disneyland for that! It's a very close walk to and from the park. Very convenient. The breakfast area is VERY small and it runs out really fast - I suggest getting your breakfast early (8ish) and just taking it back to your room. The beds were comfy - but then again any bed is comfy when it's midnight and you've been walking around since 8 am. Decent shower. Nice sink/vanity area. Room was clean. Okay television. We didn't drive ourselves so parking wasn't an issue at the hotel, but the parking lot is very small.  The only time we spent in

I really was skeptical because of some of the reviews on here, but i was very pleasantly surprised! I thought the rooms would be worn down due to tons of visitors a year, but the room was actually very clean, modern and well maintained! Beds were firm and comfortable, room was spacious and had a micro/fridge, sink outside of the bathroom which is nice when someone else is using the shower/toilet. VERY close to disneyland.. we parked the car at the hotel and walked. They give you instructions at the front desk. It took us maybe 10 mins from the tram to walk to our room. PRO.. shower worked very good, quick to heat and good water pressure. CON.. a/c in room is a window a/c and took the room FOREVER  to cool off. The staff is very nice and helpful, parking lot is very small. My

This was not the worst hotel by any means and actually is close to the trams that take you to Disneyland, however when we arrived there were zero parking spots. In fact, cars had begun to park behind other vehicles in designated spots blocking them in because there was no where to park and you cannot park on the main road (Ball St). The proximity and price were great but this is a much older hotel so everything no matter how clean it really is looks dingy and a bit run down. We only stayed one night however and I think it was perfect for that. If you plan on coming with more than one vehicle though be aware you may have to park on a different street and walk over to the hotel until a spot clears, and even then there's no guarantee that someone won't box you in.

Summary Heading: Cute on the outside, elegant on the inside.
Summary: Loved it! All rooms close to pool, which is warm! Staff super nice.  Our family also enjoyed breakfast every morning. We will definitely come again.

This hotel is "tired." There were serious stains on the carpet and ceiling.  The light fixtures were dim, especially noticeable over the lavatory. The TV was an old CRT dinosaur, and the radio didn't work at all. We were there for 4 nights. The beds, pillows, shower, towels, and staff were very good. The bed covers were suspiciously dark when viewed with the stained carpet. The staff insisted we could not enter the Disney parking lot at the back of the hotel because it was for "employees only," but people did all day and night, making getting to Disney easy.  Breakfast was in an incredibly cramped space, but choices were okay, and trays were provided to take it out. We will never stay there again, but we are not unhappy that we did.

Good place to hang your hat for a couple of nights. Price was good and the breakfast was fair. One night I was awoken from a sound sleep from the fireworks from Disneyland. Great sight but scared the sh*# out of me. I would stay here again.
Great location , a very tired best western.  Not greatest particular well when arrived.

Summary Heading: Could Be a Whole Lot Better
Summary: We planned a trip to Disneyland (that's another story) and everywhere we wanted to stay was booked so we settled for the Courtesy Inn. The owners were pleasant and the area was clean. The breakfast that they had was okay with micro sandwiches and pancakes that you could take to your room. What I had an issue with was the shower. It suffered from the old time system where is someone from another room flushed a toilet or turned on their tap the shower water became scalding.  We had our six year old grandson with us and he was almost burned. I am surprised that they have not been sued as of yet. The other minor problems were that the pool was dirty and was not attended to, the windows are single pane and the walls are thin. We could hear the people next to us every night.  The walk

The value for the price was excellent.  The microwave and fridge in the room gave us the choice of eating breakfast in our room or with the other guests, as well as being able to prepare and keep our lunches and snacks cool for the long touring days.  There is a really nice outdoor area set up for eating, snacking, coffee, etc.  Management and staff were over and above helpful when it came to questions, special requests, etc.  As mentioned in other reviews the closeness to Disney was a huge attraction - room was nice and very clean.  Parking was inconvenient if we came back after 9 but nothing that would keep us away.  Would definitely stay again.

The location of the hotel was fairly good.  It is fairly close to Disneyland.  You can walk all the way to Disneyland, or cross the street to the parking garage and take the tram into Disneyland.  The hotel pool is fairly small, but serviceable, and really great for kids.  The hot tub is pleasant.  You can also see most of the fireworks at Disneyland from the hotel pool.  The room was serviceable, although the outlet for the air conditioner was shorting out, unless we kept the fan on low.  The room had a fairly strong chemical smell, so we had to air it out.  Breakfast wasn't much to speak of, but it was free, and the cost of the hotel was quite good.
We have really enjoyed our stays here.  The rooms are very nice, the host is very helpful. The only problem we had was with parking.   The walk from here to Disneyland was very pleasant.

We discovered this great hotel in 2010 on a previous trip to Disneyland. We returned again and found the same great service and rooms. Clean, hot water, and great customer service. Especially loved the Hot tub. It was nice and hot and made for a great way of ending the day after being at Disneyland all day. We walked to the Mickey and Friends parking garage and caught the tram to the parks every day and night. In 2010 we drove to the parking garage. Either way it is just a short drive or walk. They have directions at the front desk. The breakfast was an easy way to start the day before going to the park. They even have juice, milk, coffee, tea all day. Great Rates and spent the extra money having fun. Loved having the fridge and microwave in the room. Took Super Shuttle to and

This is a great little secret!  I read the good and bad reviews and found our stay to be delightful.  The location is excellent, just off the highway.  Its within walking distance of the Disney Parking lot so you can walk to the lot then catch the Disney tram to the gate.  The only tip I have is to reverse the return directions for your trip to Disney. Its shorter and while you are walking into the exit of the parking area its not an issue.  I have young kids and the walk was quite easy for them both.  The breakfast is mostly microwave pancakes and sausage sandwiches with oatmeal and danishes, but we enjoyed it.  We don't ask a lot.  We did eat in our room most nights with the microwave but we did that by design. You will hear the fireworks from Disney at night but if you walk a

Summary Heading: Perfect for our needs- nice people!
Summary: I think the Best Western Courtesy Inn is a nice little secret that not many people know about.  The location is pretty cool - getting TO the park is a .6 mile walk around the Mickey and Friend's Parking Lot and then a tram ride to the park.  (east on Ball, south on Disney way to Magic way - there's the lot, catch a tram).  Coming back, you take the tram to the parking lot, escalator up to the second floor, walk all the way to the back, back down the stairs, out the back parking lot and there's the hotel!  So nice for a return to the hotel after a long day at Disneyland!  They give you instructions at the front desk.  The room was perfect for our needs.  Comfy bed, good pillows, and CLEAN!  A bit noisy on Ball road (but we used to live next to a highway, so maybe we're used to

Had a great stay here, this hotel is rated as a 2 Diamond by AAA, but is much better than that.   Very nicely appointed rooms, top sheeted beds, lots of pillows, free Wi-Fi.   We asked for extra towels and received them.   Excellent location, very clean, very close to  Disneyland.   The  continental breakfast was pretty good, hot & cold cereal, toast, danish, fruit, juice.   The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable.   Free parking, when other hotels in the area charge $8 to $12 a day.    We had an excellent time and would not hesitate to stay there again.

Summary Heading: One of the worst hotels I've stayed in
Summary: We've stayed at BW hotels before, and never had any issues or complaints.. until we checked in here.  The hotel's parking lot is tiny. There are only 3 very tiny rooms with King size beds, one per level, jammed into a corner next to the VERY NOISY elevator. The maid service was seriously lacking. The tv and internet power leads were plugged into a $2 extension lead that ran through the closet door frame into the room; which got knocked out of the wall every time you put something in the closet.  The TV only got 13 channels; 5 of which were the same network, adult swim and 3 of the cartoon network.  The "continental breakfast" consisted of nasty, horrible coffee and microwaveable Jimmy breakfast biscuits kept in a bowl of ice, stale pastries and bread.. and cereal if you were

Summary Heading: Not bad, but very poor value for the money
Summary: First of all let me say that I have stayed in many Best Westerns and I travel a lot for work, so I have nothing against them, and have been fortunate to stay in some good ones.  This was not one of them.  Breakfast was very weak, only had cereal and fattening muffins/danish.  Again, if I was staying in a Motel 6 or paying under $50 per night, that might be ok, but since I paid twice that, I expected a lot more.  Also, parking is an absolute nightmare, very small lot and very cramped.  Once I could not even find a spot.  Lastly, I got my 7:15am wake up call at 8:30am, which made me late for my business appointment.  I would not stay here again.

A little skepitcal at first due to the price for the room being so much lower than the surrounding hotels but once we arrived and checked in, I was completely satisfied! Spent the entire weekend at the hotel since we were visiting Disneyland on Saturday. Rooms were spacious and very clean. No odors or plumbing issues as other people had posted on their hotel reviews. I honestly have no complaints about this hotel! Friendly staff, great service, and a pretty decent selection for the free continental breakfast too! Close to Disneyland, only a short drive to Disney parking. You could walk if you're up to it, but as we were visiting with our 3 and 7 yr old children we chose not to walk, especially with the park being open so late, we did enough walking! Pool was nice, its outdoor,

I reserved a non-smoking room.  When I checked in all the non-smoking rooms were taken.  Since it was after 7:00 and I had my family, I could not find another hotel.  For $40.00 more I could have purchased the larger non-smoking room.  The smoke odor was horrible and the room was next to the street.  All night I heard the trucks go up and down the street.   The hotel did have a nice continental breakfast and the bed was comfortable.  But I should have gotten the room I reserved.  There are a variety of hotels in the area for the next Disneyland visit.

A clean, neat room is what I look for and appreciate. We chose this particular motel because it was so close to Disneyland and a friend that lives in Anaheim. The room wasn't ready but no big deal as we were 1/2 hr. early than check in time. The room was ready in 20 minutes.  The first thing I notice when entering the room is the room is not covered up in a heavy perfumy smell like so many other rooms are at other motels, but it smelled like it had just been freshly cleaned. The room was rather small, for the price, and for my taste, with too much furniture in it for such a small room, but the room was nice and CLEAN. The bed was comfortable enough and my only real complaint is the walls are very thin. You can hear every time someone in an adjourning room turns on their

We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived at the hotel.  Trip Advisor reviews were all over the board, with better ones lately, so we booked two rooms for the family trip to Disneyland.  The location was great as it is just next to the driveway into the parking garage at Disneyland and just off the freeway.  The location doesn't have the crush of people you see on the other side of the park.  You could either drive into the park or take a walk-we opted to drive since we didn't want the extra walking after a long day. The rooms were large and very clean.  The microwave, fridge and coffee pot are always appreciated.  Ther were plenty of pillows and towels in the rooms. The owners have really spent a bunch of time and money making this hotel a real gem.  The parking lot was

Summary Heading: Great place in a pinch if you are only staying one night
Summary: I chose this place over the gargantuan hotels nearby, since I was only here in the area for one night. Parking lot here is a bit tiny, but there is also street parking. Be careful and make sure you keep all belongings in the trunk or take it with you in your room. I was given a room on the 2nd floor nearby the elevator. There was only 2 people working the front entrance. No security guard on site. It was quiet during the day but at night you can hear everything. The room was clean and sufficient, nothing to complain about. Since there is no restaurant on site, the hotel menu of services include some restaurants that deliver. I found this handy because I did not want to drive around searching for eateries. All in all, a simple, clean, and functional place to stay for a great

Summary Heading: Our Disneyland Hotel from now on...
Summary: We arrived at the hotel and as soon as we walked in we were impressed with the size of the room. We had a room with 2 doubles and it still had plenty of space. Room was very clean. The decor was homely. The pictures on TripAdvisor are very outdated. Fridge and micro a HUGE PLUS!!! Housekeeping service was great throughout our 4 night stay. Walk to tram seemed a little distant, but once we did it once, it was a breeze. The front desk clerk did advise us that we can take a short cut back to the hotel from the park but not into the park which was good enough for me since we were tired coming back not going to Disneyland. There is an AM PM right across the street which was convenient for snacks at anytime.Continental breakfast was pretty good. Loved that they had little trays to

Let's start off by saying I'm not picky about accommodations. Planned on spending most of our time out and about. But some problems with this motel can not be ignored;  -Water pressure in the shower was non-existent. You dont realize how big of a deal this is until you really want to take a nice long shower! -Location. I knew going in that this place was not near the entrance, and would be a bit of a walk. I thought, hey I'm in shape, the walk will do me good! I won't do that again. Stay somewhere near the entrance. -Our room was next to a smoking room and you could smell the smoke filtering through the adjoining door. Gross! -TV kept turning on and off on it's own, but the manager was quick to come by to fix. -Maid service didn't show up till 4pm one day when we were already

Summary Heading: Comfortable stay at a great price
Summary: We stayed at this hotel in November. Room was not big but was nicely decorated (much nicer than the average motel at this price), very clean, and quiet. Manager went out of his way to make sure we were comfortable and was helpful with requests. Continental breakfast was very good and well above the average for a hotel in this price range, offering a good variety of continental fare. Hotel is a bit of a walk from the park  and main "out-of-park" restaurants that we could see -- others may have found closer restaurants. We liked the walk  (maybe 15-20 minutes?) but something to keep in mind if you do not have a vehicle and don’t like to walk. You can take the Disney shuttle back to a parking lot that is close to the hotel instead and then a shorter walk – ask at the front desk. We

I recently stayed here with my family. There were 13 of us all together. We were here for "Christmas" at Disneyland. And the hotel worked out perfectly for us. The rooms are smaller but they were okay considering we were only paying about 70 dollars a night with four people to each of our 3 rooms (the 13th was a few month old baby). They were not able to get us rooms next to each other because of how busy they were but they kept us on the same floor. They offer a SMALL complimentary breakfast they do have a waffle machine however it is outside in a different area from the rest of the food. They were very accomadating for us they gave us a late check out. And overall I would come back and stay again as well as recommend the hotel to friend who are going to disneyland on a budget.

My partner and I really enjoyed our stay (2 nights) at the property in October 2010. As we had read some comments from 2006 about the hotel we couldn't believe how well the hotel had improved since then, if those comments were ever true anyway :) . Have to mention also that the hotel has won the AAA Silver award in 2010! Our room was spacious, clean and quiet, breakfast was very good with the basics (toast, cereals, fresh juice, coffee, tea, fresh fruit). Hotel has a nice warm pool and the jacuzzi which was under repair when we visited. The walk to Disney Downtown was 'just around a corner', about 15min slow walk. Hotel manager let us store our baggage for free for the whole day, much appreciated!  We will definitely stay here next time when we'll bring our kids with us!

Summary Heading: Wonderful hotel in every way except for the shower......
Summary: We drove to Anaheim and arrived a this hotel at 1am and were pleasantly surprised to see that the desk manager had reserved a parking spot for us. He and the desk staff were very helpful throughout our 3 night stay and accommodated every need. The breakfast was good, especially for small children, with bagels, toast, frozen waffles, hard boiled eggs, fruit, yogurt, cereals (name brand) and coffee and juice. There is a small eating area in the lobby and a patio outside. The parking lot is very small but luckily we did not have to use our car during our stay. The microwave and fridge in each room was nice. The only cons were the broken ice machine and the poor water pressure and hot water in our shower. It seriously took almost one minute of the water running in order to build up

This is an excellent place to stay if you're going to Disneyland. It's literally around the corner and a quick 3-5 minute walk to the parks and Downtown Disney.  The room was very clean!! All of the furniture was updated and in excellent condition. It was really quiet too. The only thing that I didn't care for was the one of the nights we returned to the hotel pretty late and the parking lot was full so we had to park in the street. Nothing happened or anything and the parking lot is really small, but still, I didn't want to park in the street.

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel for a great price!
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights. We stayed there because of its close proximity to Disneyland. After reading previous reviews, I was worried that we were going to a dumpy hotel. However, when we arrived, the hotel was very clean and updated. We head a king size bed in our room, and the room was newly decorated, with microwave, coffeemaker, and fridge. It also has wireless internet. It was a very nice room. The hotel has free continental breakfast, which was a big seller for us. They have strudels, toast, eggos, cereal, oatmeal, and fruit. There is no "hot" food, unless you do it yourself. They have a nice breakfast patio outside as well. We used the hot tub a lot. A definite bonus is that you have a great view of the fireworks from the hot tub. It beats staying in Disney
very nice hotel,,,free parking,,free wi-fi,,,wonderful breakfast,,,fantastic staff,,neat & clean place.

Whilst the proximity to Disneyland is good, the quality of the hotel is not. Our family of 4 awoke to a gurgling sound at 11pm. When my husband checked it out there was revolting dirty water coming up through our sink and overflowing onto the floor in our room - another room's grey water/sewage. Revolting. We demanded a new room, had to move the 2 kids, luggage etc in the middle of the night. In the morning we discussed the incident and asked if it had happened before - we were told "no". It appears from other feedback on this site that it has happened before. The best the hotel could do was offer a $25 discount - pittance and certainly not eough to make up for the experience. Do NOT stay here, there are plenty of other options.

Summary Heading: Good Deal but there's Much Nicer...
Summary: We stayed for two days at the Best Western Courtesy Inn over a weekend trip to Disneyland for a Company Sponsored Event.  I have to admit, I wish I would have done a little bit more research on the hotels in the Anaheim area before picking this one, but it was a last minute choice and was the first one to come up on the Best Western Website. They did offer me a very good deal for our two night stay (I was told it was an airline industry rate, but really don't know if it was or not) and all the staff was extremely friendly.  When they say it's a few blocks from Disneyland, that is true, but it's definitely not a few blocks away from the ENTERANCE to Disneyland.  It is more like a 20+ minute walk to the park.   ****HOWEVER, there is an Anaheim trolley that will take you into the

Summary Heading: Had to leave during my stay!!! HORRIBLE!!!
Summary: I do not know what was going on with the hotel staff on this trip but it was so horrible I had to leave after a few nights!!!!   Besides what some people have already written here about the smells in the rooms of raw sewage and cigarette smoke, not so clean rooms, etc...  We witnessed on several occasions staff of the hotel coming out to yell at different people. We couldn't really tell what was going on and quite frankly didn't really want to know. But we did notice they closed one side of the parking lot to car and foot traffic and put up No Tresspassing signs. Funny thing was that the hotel staff would yell at these people, but they wouldn't yell back, they'd just leave. We couldn't figure out what they had done or why the hotel staff would yell at them in front of guests.

Summary Heading: Seriously the WORST hotel in the ENTIRE WORLD.
Summary: I am not surprised in the least to see that other reviewers share my opinion of this hotel. This was BY FAR the WORST hotel I have EVER stayed at.
