Our room was not clean upon check in - and even after it had been "cleaned" there were crumbs on the floor near the bed, pubic hair on the bathroom floor near the toilet, and the counter by the sink was dirty. The room smelled overwhelmingly like cleaning product. The staff was unfriendly and very socially awkward. Half of the ammenities listed on the website were not ACTUALLY offered once you reached the hotel. The website claimed a free shuttle to Disneylands main entrance - there was no shuttle - but we were told we could take a $6 trolley to and from Disneyland. The website boasts great location - .3 miles away from the main

I have to admit, after reading the reviews on this website about this hotel I was very apprehensive about staying here.  But since I was using my air miles to pay for part of my vacation I was very limited in my choice of hotels.  This was the only hotel that had rooms available during our selected dates.  So, we decided to go and make the best of it.  I was very pleasantly surprised when we checked in.  We stayed at the Best Western Courtesy from Dec 15 - 19, 2006 (room 304). Our room was very clean and comfortable. The carpet and flooring were new and therefore very clean. The furniture and drapes were equally new and the room had a fairly fresh coat of paint. The beds were extremely comfortable - not saggy but not too hard either. The rooms are air conditioned, but since we

Summary Heading: If you want to destroy your vacation go to this hotel
Summary: I want to call this junk hotel " worst western". We took 2 rooms and at the first night after 8 hours driving from cupertino the first thing you want to do is to take a shower  but the bath and the toilet were clog. Although shower heads were made for people 5' and under.    Continential breakfast was perfect and saved us money.  Coffee, Juice, milk, cereals and danish was good enough for breakfast.  Staff was friendly minus Male manager who didn't want to be bothered.  problems were dealt with quickly and friendly.  Pool and hot tub were clean and neat and nice to soak in after a day at Disney.  Can watch fireworks from there.  Weekends are nosey as there is a restaurant right beside hotel, and has a lounge that stay open late, but nothing major. Yes this motel is right next door to Disneyland, but if you can't sleep after walking back to your room, what's the point.  Trucks and noise all night.  "No Smoking Room" seems to be just last-night's smoking room that has been over-sprayed with deodorizer.  Husband tried to contact us, nobody answered the hotel phones from 8am to 9am straight- totally unacceptable.    There are several GREAT family motel choices nearby.  Yes, some of them are a five-minute drive to Disneyland and you'll have to pay the Disneyland parking fee, but you'll save $30 on the room.  We chose this motel hoping for a quick afternoon break to the room, but the kids wouldn't swim in the "scummy" pool and we couldn't open the windows to air out the room due to 100 degree heat this week.  A waste of time

Finally after honking our horn a middle eastern man staggered out of the office and checked us in.  The room was sooooo bad.  Ants everywhere!  No hot water!!  Dirty tissues behind furniture.  When I talked to the manager he told me that I should have stayed at the Disney hotels if I wanted luxary.  The pool is a joke and so is the breakfast...coffee and a roll.  NEVER AGAIN.

Summary Heading: Good location for walking to Disney, but very noisey!
Summary: Hotel is very basic lodging within short walk of Disney. Unfortunately the location is right on the street the trucks use for Disney deliveries ALL night long. Bring your earplugs! To get to Disney all we did was walk behind the hotel through the Disney employee parking about 200 yards. Walk through the parking garage and catch the free shuttle tram to the gate. No need to use the resort trolley system. We had to change rooms at 3:30am the first night because of heavy deoderizer smell they used to cover up spilled cologne on the carpet. We thought the smell was 'normal' cleaner smell until our eyes and nose started burning, but the second room did not have that smell.
